Maist warthie Theophilus,: A hale lock o fowk haes taen ït ïn han tae draa up an accoont o aa tha thïngs that haes cum aboot amang iz.
The’ hae brocht thegither whut wus hannit doon tae iz frae yins that saa ït aa wi thair ain een richt frae tha stairt, an that becum sarvints o tha Wurd o God.

Sae, haein lukt ïntae ït aa masel richt frae whan tha hale storie begun, A thocht ït wud be a guid thïng fer me tae pit doon a trig accoont fer ye forbye, Theophilus, tae mak ye shair o tha truith o whut ye hae bin lairnt.

Whaniver Herod wus Kïng o Judea, thair wus thïs preesht caad Zechariah. Noo he belanged til tha preeshtlie connection o Abijah; an hïs wife Lïzbeth, hir femlie went bak til tha dochtèrs o Aaron as weel.
An the’ wur baith upricht ïn tha Loard’s sicht, keepin aa tha commauns an laas o tha Loard.
But the’ haed nae femlie, fer Lïzbeth cudnae hae weans; an tha baith o thaim wus weel up ïn yeirs.
Yin time whan ït wus tha turn o Zechariah’s connection fer daein thair dutie ïn tha Hoose o God,
Zechariah wus pïckt oot bi tha draain o lots - laik tha preeshts ay daen ïn thaim days - tae gang ïntil tha Halie o Halies an burn ïncense.
Noo whaniver tha time cum roon fer burnin tha ïncense, aa tha fowk wus ootbye, prayin.
An aa o a suddent an angel o tha Loard appeart, stannin on tha richt han side o tha althar o ïncense!
Zechariah wus tuk bak whan he saen tha angel an he wus hairt scarred.
But tha angel saed, "Dïnnae be feart, Zechariah, fer God haes heerd yer prayer, an yer wife Lïzbeth wull gie ye a wee sinn! An ye maun caa hïm Jhone.
Ye’ll be quare an gled whan he’s boarn,
an sae wull a brave wheen o ither fowk alang wi ye.
Fer he wull be ootstannin ïn tha sicht o tha Loard.
He’s no tae tak wine or onie ither kine o strang drïnk,
an he’ll be fu o tha Halie Spïrit
richt frae hïs mither’s wame.
An he’ll gether monie an Israelite bak tae tha Loard thair God.
He wull be laik Elijah, fu o God’s Spïrit an pooer;
he wull saffen tha hairts o tha faithers tae thair weans,
turnin contrairie yins tae a richt wye o thïnkin;
an he wull gang afore tha Loard tae mak tha fowk readie fer hïm."
Zechariah axt tha angel: "Hoo cud A be shair whut ye’r sayin’s richt? Fer baith me an tha wife ïs weel up ïn yeirs!"
Then tha angel saed, "A’m Gabriel. An A’m cum strecht frae God hissel fer tae gie ye thïs guid news.
Mairk thïs weel! Seein as ye niver believed whut A toul ye, ye’ll be struck dum an no be fït tae taak tae tha wean’s boarn. But thïs’ll cum aboot ïn tha richt time."
Aa tha while, tha yins ootbye wus wunnèrin hoo cum Zechariah wus takkin sae lang ïn tha Loard’s Hoose.
Whaniver he cum oot he cudnae say ocht ava, ner taak tae tha fowk. The’ knowed bi tha signs he wus giein, he maun hae saen a vïsion ïn tha Hoose o tha Loard, but aa tha while he cudnae taak.
Bye an bye, whaniver he haed hïs turn at tha althar daen, he went bak hame.
No lang eftèr that, Lïzbeth fun oot she wus gaun tae hae a wean, an sae she stapt ïn tha hoose oot o sicht fer five month.
Tha Loard haes bin mair ner guid tae me, Lïzbeth saed, "an A’m no affrontit onie lang’r wi haein nae femlie."
Whan Lïzbeth wus sïx month gan, God sent tha angel Gabriel tae tha toon o Nazareth ïn Galilee,
tae a virgin bi tha name o Mary that wus trystit tae a man caad Joseph, descendit frae Kïng Davit.
Tha angel saed til hir, "Fair faa ye, blisst amang weemen, tha Loard ïs wi ye."
Mary wus aa throu hirsel as she tried tae mak sense o whut tha angel haed telt hir.
Dïnnae be feart, Mary, tha angel saed, "fer ye hae fun favour wi God.
Tak tent, ye ir fer haein a wean, a sinn, an ye maun caa hïm Jesus.
He wull be ootstannin, an be caad tha Sinn o tha Maist Heich God.
An God wull gie hïm tha throne o hïs forefaither Davit,
an he wull rule ower Israel fer iver an ay,
an thair’ll be nae enn tae hïs Kïngdom."
Mary axt tha angel, "Hoo can A hae a wean, wi me a virgin an niver bin wi a man?"
Tha angel toul hir,

Tha Halie Spïrit an tha pooer o God wull cum doon on ye. An sae tha wean boarn tae ye wull be halie, an wull be caad tha Sinn o God.
LUK.1.36	An yer cousin Lïzbeth ïs fer haein a sinn ïn hir oul age as weel; tha mair fowk thocht she cudnae hae onie, but she’s ïn hir sïxth month,

Mary saed, "Weel, A’m tha sarvint o tha Loard an A’ll dae whutiver he wants. Sae, jist let ït aa cum aboot laik ye say." An then tha angel went awa frae hir.
Eftèr thïs, Mary got hirsel readie, an heidit aff ïn a bïg hurrie tae a toon ïn tha hïlls o Judea.
Up she cum thonner tae Zechariah’s hoose, an toul Lïzbeth ït wus guid tae see hir.
Whaniver Lïzbeth heerd tha soon o Mary’s voice, tha bairn gien a lep ïn hir wame, an she wus fu o tha Halie Spïrit.
Lïzbeth caad oot wi a gled cry tae Mary, "Amang aa weemen ye’r blisst bi God, an blisst be tha wean ye’r fer haein!
But hoo cum ït’s me haes bin gien sae bïg an honour, wi tha mither o ma Loard cumin tae vïsit me?
Tha mïnit A heerd yer wairm wurds, A cud feel tha bairn ïn ma wame giein a lep fer joy.
Ye ir ïn fer a blissin, Mary, fer ye dïdnae doot tha Loard wud dae jist whut he toul ye."
Then Mary saed: "Ma sowl gies praise tae tha Loard,
an ma spïrit ïs gled ïn God ma Saviour!
Fer he haes tuk notysh o me, a puir sarvin lass, an aa genèrations frae noo on wull caa me blisst.
Tha Michtie Yin haes daen wunnèrfu thïngs fer me, an Halie ïs hïs name.
Hïs mercie bides wi thaim that houls hïm ïn reverence, richt doon tha genèrations.
Hoo pooerfu hïs michtie airm ïs, that can skail thaim that’s fu o thairsels.
He haes brocht doon tha michtie frae thair heich saits o pooer, an lïftit up tha doon-an-oots.
He haes fed tha hung’rie wi guid thïngs, an he’s turnt tha weel-aff yins bak empie-hannit.
He haes lukt eftèr hïs sarvint Israel, an he niver forgets tae be merciefu.
Fer he promist thïs tae oor faithers - tae Abraham an aa hïs childèr - fer iver an ay."
Then Mary stapt ower wi Lïzbeth fer aboot thrie month afore gaun bak hame.
Noo whan Lïzbeth’s time cum fer tha wean tae be boarn, she haed a wee sinn.
Wurd wusnae lang gaun roon o hoo guid tha Loard haed bin til hir, an hir freens an nighbers wus aa wile plaised.
Whaniver tha wean wus echt day oul, thair wus a guid turnoot o freens an nighbers at tha circumcisin, an the’ wur aa wantin tae caa hïm eftèr hïs faither.
But "Na!" Lïzbeth saed, "He maun hae tha name o Jhone."
Whut! the’ saed, "Nane o yer femlie wus iver a Jhone."
Sae the’ axt tha wean’s faither, bi makkin signs, whut he thocht tha name shud be.
He waved fer thaim tae get hïm sumthin tae write on, but the’ wur aa tuk bak whan he püt thïs doon: "Hïs name ïs Jhone!"
Strecht aff Zechariah fun hïs tung an he stairtit giein praise tae God.
Aa tha fowk roon aboot wus dumfoonèrt, an ït wus tha taak o tha hale kintrieside o Judea.
An iveriebodie that heerd aboot ït wus wunnèrin whut wye thïs wee fella wud turn oot. Oniebodie cud see that tha han o tha Loard wus upon hïm.
Then hïs faither Zechariah, fu o tha Halie Spïrit, stairtit makkin a proaphesie:

Praise tha Loard God o Israel, fer he haes cum doon amang hïs fowk an pyed tha coast o settin thaim free.

Jhone wus raired an he becum strang ïn spïrit, an he leeved oot ïn tha wuldèrness tae tha time cum tae stairt praichin tae Israel.
Roon aboot thïs time tha Emperor, Caesar Augustus, gien oardèrs that a heid-coont wus tae be taen o aa tha fowk ïn iverie pairt o hïs empire.
Thïs wus tha furst coont daen whan Quirinius wus tha Guviner o Syria.
An iveriebodie wus haein tae gang tae whar the’ wur boarn tae pit thair names doon fer ït.
Noo acause Joseph’s femlie went bak tae Kïng Davit, he haed cum frae Nazareth ïn Galilee tae Bethlehem ïn Judea, whar Davit wus frae.
Mary, hïs wife tae be, trevelt wi hïm, tha mair o bein near hir time.
But whan the’ wur thair, hir time cum tae hae tha wean.
An she haed hir furst babbie, a sinn. She rowlt hïm up ïn bïts o claith an püt hïm ïn a manger wi tha fother, acause thair wus nae ruim fer thaim ïn tha lüdgin hoose.
That nicht a wheen o herdmen wus oot ïn tha fiels mindin thair sheep.
Aa o a suddent, an angel o tha Loard cum amang thaim, an tha hale kintrie wus lichtit up bi tha glorie o tha Loard, an the’ wur wile feart.
But tha angel saed, "Dïnnae be feart, fer A’m brïngin yis tha best news iver; an ït’s fer tha hale warl!
Tha Saviour, aye, tha Christ, tha Loard, haes thïs nicht bin boarn ïn Bethlehem, tha toon o Davit.
An thïs ïs hoo ye’ll ken hïm. Ye’ll fin a babbie, rowlt ïn bïts o claith, lyin amang tha fother ïn a manger."
An aa o a suddent thair wus a hale thrang o angels, tha airmies o heiven, praisin God an sayin,
Glorie tae God ïn tha maist heich heiven, an peace on irth tae aa fowk that plaises hïm.
Whaniver tha angels went bak tae heiven, tha herdmen saed yin tae anither, "Cum on, we’ll gang tae Bethlehem an see thïs wunnèrfu thïng that haes happent, that tha Loard haes toul iz aboot."
The’ hurriet aff an the’ fun Mary an Joseph. An thair wus tha babbie lyin ïn tha manger!
Whaniver the’ saen hïm, tha shepherds toul whut tha angel haed saed aboot thïs wean, an aa that haed happent.
An the’ wur aa thunnèrstruck bi whut the’ heerd frae tha shepherds.
Mary dïdnae say much, but she kep turnin these thïngs ower an ower ïn hir hairt.
Tha shepherds went bak tae hirdin thair sheep ïn tha fiels, praisin an giein glorie tae God fer whut the’ haed saen an heerd. It haed bin jist tha wye tha angel haed toul thaim.
Echt days on, whaniver the' circumcised tha wean, he wus gien tha name Jesus, tha name that tha angel saed tae caa hïm lang afore he wus boarn.

Whan tha time cum roon fer Mary an Joseph tae dae whut tha Laa o Moses saed tae dae eftèr a wean’s birth, the’ tuk hïm tae tha Hoose o God ïn Jerusalem tae mak thair offerin an tae present hïm tae tha Loard.
Tha Laa o tha Loard saed that tha furst boarn wee fella ay belangs tae tha Loard.
As weel as thïs, tha Laa o tha Loard saed that the’ haed tae offer a secryfice o twa turtle doos or twa young pïgeons.
Noo thair wus thïs man ïn Jerusalem caad Simeon, that wus a guid, God-fearin man, fu o tha Halie Spïrit an lukkin forrit tae tha cumin o tha Messiah,
acause tha Halie Spïrit haed toul hïm that he wudnae dee afore he haed saen Christ tha Loard.

That day he wus guidit bi tha Halie Spïrit tae gang tae tha Hoose o God whan Mary an Joseph wus thair tae dae whut tha Laa saed. Whaniver he saa tha wean, he tuk hïm up ïn hïs airms an praised God an saed,

Then Simeon gien thaim a blissin, an toul Mary tha mither tae tak heed o thïs: "Tha wean wull hae a pooerfu effect on monie a bodie ïn Israel. Some’ll rise up an some wull faa. He ïs a sign frae God, but a lock o fowk wull hae naethin tae dae wi hïm.
Thïs wye aa tha thochts ïn fowks’ hairts wull be oot ïn tha apen, an as fer you Mary, sorra as shairp as a sword wull stab yer hairt."

Then thair wus a wee weeda wumman, echtie-fower yeir oul, caad Anna, that wus a proaphitess. She haed bin merriet tae hir man fer seiven yeir afore he deed. She wus a dochtèr o Phanuel o tha tribe o Asher. She wud stap ïn tha Hoose o God, prayin an fastin nicht an day,
an tae aa thaim that wus lukkin forrit tae Jerusalem bein set free, she kep on tellin thaim aboot tha wean.
Eftèr Mary an Joseph haed cairriet oot aa that needit daen tae keep tha Laa, the’ went bak hame tae tha toon o Nazareth ïn Galilee.
An as tha wean wus growin up, he wus strang, fu o wusdom an blisst bi God.
Noo iverie yeir hïs faither an mither went tae Jerusalem fer tha Faist o tha Passower.
An whan he wus twal yeir oul, the’ went up tae Jerusalem fer tha Faist, laik the’ ay daen.

Whaniver tha Faist wus ower, hïs mither an faither set oot fer hame alang wi ither femlies, no knowin that Jesus haed styed behin ïn tha cïtie. The’ jaloused he wus ïn tha companie, an the’ trevelt on a hale day afore the’ mïsst hïm.
Whan the’ cudnae fin hïm amang thair femlie an freens, the’ went bak tae Jerusalem tae luk fer hïm.
Sae ïn tha enn ït wus thrie days afore the’ fun hïm. An thair he wus, sïttin ïn tha coortyaird o tha Hoose o God, takkin ïn whut tha taichers wur sayin, an quïzzin thaim.
Aa that heerd hïm cudnae believe tha wye he wus answerin an tha much he knowed.
Whan Mary an Joseph saen hïm the’ wur dumfoonèrt, an hïs mither saed, "Wean dear, why hae ye daen thïs tae iz? Me an yer faither haes bin worried seeck lukkin fer ye."
Why wur ye lukkin fer me? he axt. "Dïd ye no ken that A maun be aboot ma Faither’s bïzness here ïn hïs Hoose?"
But the’ dïdnae unnèrstan whut he wus taakin aboot.
Jesus went bak doon tae Nazareth wi thaim an ay daen as he wus bïd, but Mary kep aa these thïngs ïn hir hairt.
An Jesus growed up, wise an strang an weel plaisin tae God an man.

Noo, whan Tiberius Caesar haed rult fer tha maist pairt o fïfteen yeir, Pontius Pilate wus tha Guviner o Judea, Herod wus tha Tetrarch ower Galilee, hïs brither Phïlip wus tha Tetrarch ower Iturea an Trachonitis, an Lysanias wus tha Tetrarch ower Abilene. An Annas an Caiaphas wus tha Heich Preeshts.
At thïs time, God spauk tae Jhone, tha sinn o Zechariah, oot on tha muirs.
Jhone gaed aa roon tha Joardan rïver, praichin an tellin tha fowk the' shud be baptised fer tae show the’ haed turnt awa frae thair sïns, an tae show the' haed turnt tae God fer hïm tae forgie thaim.

Ye maun show bi tha wye ye leeve that ye hae repentit. Dïnnae stairt sayin tae yersels, 'We hae Abraham fer oor faither', an hae daen wi that! Fer A tell ye that oot o thon stanes God can mak weans fer Abraham.
God’s hatchit ïs noo at tha ruit o tha trees an thaim that dïnnae gie guid fruit wull be fellt an pitcht ïntae tha fire."
Whut’ll we dae then? tha thrang wus axin hïm.
Jhone telt thaim: "Tha yin that haes twa shïfts shud gie yin tae hïm that haes nane, an tha yin that haes mait shud dae tha same."

An tha sodgers axt hïm: "Whut shud we dae?" Jhone saed til thaim: "Dïnnae squeeze tha last pennie oot o fowk, ner blekmail thaim fer thair siller; an mak dae wi whut ye get pyed an be gled o ït!"
Aa tha fowk wus waitin an wunnèrin wus Jhone mebbe tha Christ.
But Jhone toul thaim aa: "A’m onlie baptisin wi wattèr. But yin’ll cum that wull baptise ye wi tha Halie Spïrit an wi fire. He ïs michtier ner me. A’m no fït tae lowse hïs buits fer hïm.

Jhone praicht tha Guid News ïn monies a wye tae aa tha fowk.

Arphaxad wus tha sinn o Shem.
Shem wus tha sinn o Noah.
Noah wus tha sinn o Lamech.
Lamech wus tha sinn o Methuselah.
Methuselah wus tha sinn o Enoch.
Enoch wus tha sinn o Jared.
Jared wus tha sinn o Mahalalel.
Mahalalel wus tha sinn o Kenan.
Kenan wus tha sinn o Enosh.
Enosh wus tha sinn o Seth.
Seth wus tha sinn o Adam.
An Adam wus tha sinn o God.
An Jesus, bein fu o tha Halie Spïrit, cum bak frae tha Joardan, an wus taen bi tha Spïrit ïntae tha wuldèrness.
Fer fowertie days he wus tempit bi tha Deil, an ïn aa thaim days he dïdnae ait ocht ava. An at tha enn o tha time, he wus gye hung’rie.
An tha Deil saed tae hïm: "If ye ir tha Sinn o God, tell that stane thair tae turn ïntae breid."
An Jesus spauk bak tae hïm an saed, "It ïs writ doon, that man cannae leeve bi breid alane, [but bi iverie wurd o God]."
Then tha Deil tuk hïm up heich, an lut hïm see aa tha kïngdoms o tha warl ïn a weethin o time.
Tha Deil saed tae hïm: "Aa tha pooer o these kïngdoms A wull gie ye, an tha glorie that gangs wi thaim, fer ït’s mine tae gie tae whaiver A laik.
Gin ye wull jist boo doon tae me, ït wull aa be yer ain."
Jesus saed til hïm: "Awa or that, Satan! Fer tha Guid Buik says ye ir tae wurship tha Loard yer God, an tae sarve naebodie but hïm."
An tha Deil brocht hïm tae Jerusalem, an tuk hïm up tae tha verie tap o tha Hoose o God, an saed tae hïm: "If ye ir tha Sinn o God, throw yersel doon frae here!
Fer tha Guid Buik says: 'He wull tell hïs angels tae luk eftèr ye an keep an ee on ye.
In thair hans the’ wull haud ye up, less ye dunt yer fit agin a stane'."
An Jesus saed bak tae hïm: "It’s ïn tha Buik forbye: 'Ye ir no tae temp tha Loard yer God!' "
An whan tha Deil haed stapt aa tha tempin, he tuk aff an left hïm alane fer a while.
An Jesus cum bak ïn tha pooer o tha Spïrit ïntae Galilee; an he wus tha taak o tha hale kintrie roon aboot.
An he taicht ïn thair Meetin Hooses, an he haed a great name amang thaim aa.
An he cum tae Nazareth, whar he haed bin raired; an as he ay daen, he went ïntae tha Meetin Hoose on tha Sabbath day, an stud up fer tae read.
The’ gien hïm tha screed o tha proaphit Isaiah, an whan he haed apent tha buik, he fun tha place whar ït wus writ doon:

Tha Spïrit o tha Loard ïs cum ower me, fer he haes anointit me tae tell oot tha Guid News tae tha puir; he haes sent me fer [tae heal tha hairtbrauk], tae lowse thaim that’s bun, tae gie sicht tae tha blin, fer tae set free thaim that’s trod doon, 
LUK.4.19	an fer tae praich tha yeir o tha Loard’s grace.
Whan Jesus haed rowlt up tha screed, he gien ït bak tae tha man ïn chairge, an he sut doon. An naebodie ïn tha Meetin Hoose cud tak thair een aff hïm.
An he stairtit aff bi tellin thaim: "Whut ye hae jist heerd frae tha Guid Buik haes cum aboot theday."
An aa spauk weel o hïm, an the’ cud harlie tak ïn tha wunsum wurds that cum oot o hïs mooth. The’ axt, "Is thïs no Joseph’s sinn?"
He telt thaim thïs: "Nae doot Ye wull quote tha oul saw at me: 'Doctèr, heal yersel!' An ye’ll say: 'Whut we heerd ye daen ïn Capernaum, dae ït here ïn yer ain hametoon as weel.' "
An he saed, "A warrant ye thïs: nae proaphit ïs iver walcum ïn hïs ain hametoon.
A’m tellin ye tha truith, ïn tha days o Elijah, tha heivens wus shut up fer thrie yeir an sïx month, an thair wus a bïg hung’r ower aa tha lan. An thair wus monie weedas ïn Israel at tha time.
Elijah wusnae sent til onie o thaim but, onlie tae a weeda wumman ïn Serepta, near tha toon o Sidon.
Forbye, thair wus monie lepers ïn Israel ïn tha time o Elisha tha proaphit, but nane o thaim wus makkit clain, apairt frae Naaman frae Syria."
Whaniver the’ heerd these thïngs, aa tha fowk ïn tha Meetin Hoose wus wile ang’rie.
An the’ ris up, an the’ driv hïm oot o tha toon, an the’ tuk hïm up tae tha broo o tha hïll whar tha toon wus bigged, fer tae throw hïm doon heid furst.
But he passt richt throu tha mïddle o thaim, an gaed on hïs wye.
Then Jesus went on doon tae Capernaum, a toon o Galilee. An he wus taichin tha fowk thair on tha Sabbath day.
An the' wur aa thunnèrstruck wi hïs taichin, fer tha wurds he spauk wus pooerfu.
An ïn tha Meetin Hoose, thair wus a man that haed a demon, an ïll spïrit, ïn hïm. An he scraicht oot lood:
Hey! [Lea iz alane], Jesus o Nazareth! Whut dae ye want wi iz? Hae ye cum here tae dae awa wi iz? A ken richt weel wha ye ir. Ye ir tha Halie Yin o God!
But Jesus chackt hïm an saed: "Houl yer wheesht, an cum oot o hïm!" An tha demon throwed hïm tae tha grun forenent thaim aa, an ït cum oot o hïm, an ït dïdnae hurt hïm ava.
An the’ wur aa dumfoonèrt, an taakt amang thairsels, an saed, "Dïd ye iver hear tha laik o ït? Fer wi thortie an pooer he oardèrs tha ïll spïrits, an at hïs bïddin the’ cum oot!"
Sae Jesus wus tha taak o tha hale kintrieside roon aboot.
An he gaed oot o tha Meetin Hoose an on tae Simon’s hame.
Noo Simon’s guidwife’s mither wus wile baad wi a faevir, an the’ axt Jesus fer tae mak hir bettèr.
He stud ower hir, an chackt tha faevir, an ït left hir. She got up at yinst an stairtit tae luk eftèr thaim.
Noo whan tha sin wus gaun doon, aa tha yins that haed seeck fowk wi aa kines o disaises brocht thaim tae Jesus; an he püt hïs hans on iverie yin o thaim, an healt thaim.
Forbye, demons cum oot o monie o thaim, cryin oot: "Ye ir [Christ,] tha Sinn o God!" An he wud chack thaim, oardèrin thaim no tae spake, fer the’ kent that he wus tha Christ.
Whan ït wus daylicht, he depairtit an went tae a place he cud be on hïs ain. An tha fowk lukt fer hïm, an cum tae hïm, an axt hïm fer tae stye, fer the’ dïdnae want hïm tae lea thaim.
But he saed tae thaim: "A maun praich tha Guid News o tha Kïngdom o God tae tha ither toons as weel: fer that’s why A wus sent."
Sae he kep on praichin ïn tha Meetin Hooses o Galilee
Yin day, Jesus wus stannin bi tha Loch o Genessaret
An he saa twa bóats pued up bi tha wattèr’s edge. But tha fïshermen wus awa oot o thaim, an the’ wur weshin thair neyts.
An Jesus got ïntae yin o tha bóats, whut belanged tae Simon, an axt hïm tae pit oot a weethin frae tha lan. An he sut doon an taicht tha fowk frae tha bóat.
Noo whan he haed daen taakin tae tha fowk, he toul Simon, "Pit oot tae tha deep wattèr, an let doon yer neyts fer a haal."
Simon saed, "Dominie, we hae wrocht aa nicht an tuk naethin. But nanethaless, A’ll dae as ye bïd me an let doon tha neyts."
An whan the’ haed daen thïs, the’ caatcht a pooerfu lock o fïsh. Thair wus that monie that tha nettin stairtit tae cum apairt.
Sae the’ waved tae thair nighbers ïn tha ither bóat tae cum an gie thaim a han, an the’ fïllt baith bóats sae fu that the’ near sunk.
Whaniver Simon Petèr saa thïs, he faad on hïs knees afore Jesus an saed, "G’awa frae me, Loard, fer A’m a sïnfu man."
Whaniver hïm an aa that wur wi hïm saa tha haal o fïsh, the’ cud harlie tak ït ïn.
An nether cud Jeames an Jhone, tha sinns o Zebedee, that wur nighberin wi Simon. Jesus saed tae Simon, "Dïnnae be feart. Frae noo on, ït’s men ye’ll be ketchin."
Whaniver the’ haed brocht thair bóats tae lan, the’ left aa an follaed eftèr Jesus.

Anither time, whan Jesus wus ïn yin o tha toons, thair wus thïs man wile baad wi leprosie. Whaniver he saen Jesus he faad doon afore hïm an begged hïm, "Loard, ïf ye hae a mine tae, ye can mak me clain."
An he püt hïs han oot an toucht hïm, sayin, "A wull shairlie. Be clain!" An richt awa tha leprosie wus gan frae hïm.

An he chairged hïm tae tell naebodie, but bïd hïm gang an show hissel tae tha preesht. "Gie an offerin fer yer cleansin," saed Jesus, "as Moses telt iz ïn tha Laa, fer a wutness tae yin an aa that ye’r weel agane!"
But fer aa thïs, tha hale kintrieside taakt aboot hïm aa tha mair, an cum tae hear hïm ïn thair droves, an tae be cured o thair ailments.
Then Jesus tuk hissel awa frae thaim ïntae a quait place fer tae pray, as he wus ïn tha habit o daein.

Anither day, as he wus lairnin tha fowk, thair wus Pharisees an taichers o tha Laa sïttin bye. The’ haed cum frae aa tha vïllages roon aboot, oot o Galilee, an Judea an Jerusalem, an tha pooer o tha Loard wus thair fer tae heal thaim.
An luk see! - a wheen o men wus brïngin a paralysed man on a bed; an the’ wur lukkin fer a wye fer tae brïng hïm ïntae tha hoose tae lay hïm doon afore Jesus.
An whan the’ cudnae fin a róad ïn acause o aa tha thrang, the’ went up on tae tha tap o tha hoose, an lut hïm doon on hïs bed throu tha ruif, ïn amang tha fowk, richt forenent Jesus.
Whaniver he saa thair faith, he saed, "Ma freen, yer sïns ïs aa forgien."
Tha maistèrs o tha Laa an tha Pharisees stairtit taakin amang thairsels. "Wha daes he thïnk he ïs, taakin sitch blesphemie? Wha can forgie sïns but God alane?"
Jesus knowed whut thair thochts wur, an saed tae thaim: "Hoo cum yis ir thïnkin laik thïs?
Is ït aisier tae say, 'Yer sïns ir forgien', or tae say 'Get up an waak'?
But noo ye’ll see that tha Sinn o Man haes tha pooer tae forgie sïns here on irth." Jesus then saed tae tha man that haed bin paralysed: "Get up, tak yer bed wi ye, an gang awa hame!"
An richt awa he got up afore thaim, gethert up hïs beddin, an went aff hame, praisin God.
The’ cud harlie believe ït, an the’ gien glorie tae God, yit at tha same time the’ felt feart an saed, "We hae saen thïngs theday that ir ower ocht!"
Eftèr thïs, Jesus went oot an saa a tex man bi tha name of Levi, sïttin ïn hïs hut. An Jesus saed tae hïm: "Follae me!"
Levi ris up, left aa behin hïm, an follaed Jesus.
An Levi layed on a bïg spreed ïn hïs ain hoose fer Jesus, an thair wus a hale lock o tex men an tha laik thair, roon tha table wi thaim.
But tha maistèrs o tha Laa an tha Pharisees wus muttèrin tae tha follaers o Jesus: "Fer why ir ye aitin an drïnkin wi tex men an sïnners?"
An Jesus saed tae thaim: "Fowk that ir hale an hairtie dïnnae need a doctèr, but seeck fowk dae!
A hinnae cum fer tae caa guid leevin fowk tae repentance, but A hae cum tae caa sïnners."
Some fowk saed tae hïm: "Jhone’s follaers ir ay fastin an prayin, an sae dae tha follaers o tha Pharisees, but your yins ïs ay aitin an drïnkin!"
But Jesus saed tae thaim: "Ye cannae mak waddin guests fast while tha bridegruim ïs wi thaim.
Thair’ll cum a day but, whaniver tha bridegruim wull be tuk awa frae thaim, an that’ll be tha time the’ wull fast."
He toul thaim anither parable: "Naebodie taks a piece o claith frae a new cóat tae patch an oul yin. If he daes, tha new patch wull pu awa frae tha oul, an forbye the’ wudnae match.
An naebodie pits new wine ïntae oul wineskïns. Fer ïf ye dae, tha new wine wull brust tha oul skïns, tha wine wull spïll oot an tha skïns wull be ruint.
Na, ye hae tae pit new wine ïntae new skïns, [then baith wull be aa richt].
Forbye, naebodie eftèr haein drunk oul wine, wud richt awa be lukkin new wine. Fer he wud say: 'Tha oul wine ïs bettèr.' "
Cum twa Sabbaths eftèr thïs, Jesus wus gaun throu tha coarnfiels an hïs follaers pluckt tha heids aff tha coarn tae ait, giein thaim a rub atween thair hans.
An some o tha Pharisees axt thaim, "Hoo cum yis ir daein whut’s agin tha Laa on tha Sabbath day?"
Jesus gien tha answer, "Hae ye no read whut Davit daen whaniver hïm an hïs freens wus hung’rie?
Hoo he gaed ïntae tha Hoose o God, an tuk an et tha halie showbreid, an gien ït tae thaim that wus wi hïm forbye? Shair that wus agin tha Laa fer oniebodie but tha preeshts!"
An he saed tae thaim, "Tha Sinn o Man ïs Loard o tha Sabbath anaa."
Then on anither Sabbath he gaed ïntae tha Meetin Hoose tae taich tha fowk, an thair wus a man thair an hïs richt han wus wuthert.
Tha maistèrs o tha Laa an tha Pharisees kep thair een on Jesus tae see wud he heal on tha Sabbath, sae as tae hae sumthin agin hïm.
But he kent richt weel thair thochts an saed tae tha man wi tha baad han, "Stan up whar the’ can aa see ye." An up he got.
Then Jesus saed tae thaim, "Daes tha Laa say ye shud dae guid or dae ïll on tha Sabbath? Shud ye save life or dae awa wi ït?"
An lukkin roon at thaim aa, he saed tae tha man, "Streetch oot yer han!"; an he dïd, an hïs han cum as guid as tha ither yin.
The’ wur aa richt an maad an wur colloguin wi yin anither whut the’ cud dae wi Jesus.
Bye an bye Jesus went oot tae a muntin fer tae pray tae God, an he kep at ït tha hale nicht lang.
An whaniver ït wus day, he caad hïs follaers tae hïm an walled oot twal, an gien thaim tha name o "Possels":
Simon, that he caad Petèr forbye, an hïs brither Andra; Jeames an Jhone; Phïlip an Bartholomew;
Mattha an Tammas; Jeames, tha sinn o Alphaeus; Simon, tha yin the’ caad a zealot;
Judas, Jeames’s sinn; an Judas Iscariot, tha yin that bethrayed Jesus latèr on.

An he cum doon frae tha muntin wi thaim, an tuk hïs stance on a flet bït o grun; an a hale crood o hïs follaers, alang wi a wile thrang o fowk oot o Judea, an Jerusalem, an frae alang tha shores o Tyre an Sidon, cum tae hear hïm an tae be cured o thair ailments.
An tha yins vext sair wi ïll spïrits wus aa cured.
An tha hale crood o fowks wantit tae touch hïm acause a pooer o guid wus cumin oot o hïm an curin thaim aa.
An Jesus, wi hïs een on hïs follaers saed, "Blisst ir tha puir, fer yours ïs tha Kïngdom o God.
Blisst ir you that’s hung’rie noo, fer yis wull get yer fïll. Blisst ir you that’s greetin noo, fer yis wull be lachin then.
Blisst ir you whaniver fowk hait ye or gie ye tha coul shoodèr, baadmooth ye or blekin yer name, on accoont o tha Sinn o Man.
Be richt gled on that day an leap fer joy, fer yis hae a pooerfu reward waitin fer ye ïn heiven; fer thair faithers daen tha same tae tha proaphits.
But sorra tae you weel-aff fowk, fer ye hae got aa ye ir gettin!
Sorra tae you that’s fu noo, fer yis wull be hung’rie. Sorra tae you that ir lachin, fer yis wull be greetin an sorrafu.
Wae faa yis whan aa fowk spakes weel o ye, fer thair faithers daen tha same wi tha fause proaphits.
But A’m sayin tae yous that’s lïstenin: Love yer enemies, dae guid tae thaim that haits ye.
Bliss thaim that curses ye, an pray fer thaim that wushes ye ïll wull.
An ïf a bodie gies ye a slap on tha cheek, turn tha ither yin tae hïm as weel. An ïf a bodie ïs lukkin yer tap-cóat aff ye, let hïm hae yer shirt as weel.
If oniebodie axes ye fer ocht, gie ït tae thaim, an dïnnae be lukkin ït bak.
An jist dae tae ithers whut yis wud want thaim tae dae tae yersels.
An ïf yis onlie love thaim as loves yersels, thair’s naethin parteeclar aboot that. Even sïnners love tha yins that love thaim.
An ïf yis dae guid tae thaim as dae guid tae yersels, whut credit ïs that tae yis? Sïnners dae jist tha same.
An ïf yis onlie len tae thaim as yis ir hopin tae get ït bak frae, thair’s nae thenks ïn that, fer even sïnners len tae sïnners, sae as tae get bak tha same agane.
But love yer enemies, dae guid an len, no hopin tae get oniethin bak; an yis wull hae great reward an wull be sinns o tha Maist Heich, fer he ïs kine tae tha ungratefu an wïckit.
Sae be merciefu, jist as yer Faither ïs merciefu.
Dïnnae judge ithers, sae as ye'll no be judged yersels, dïnnae condemn an yis’ll no be condemned, forgie an yis’ll be forgien.
Gie an yis’ll be gien tae; a guid misure, preesed doon, shakin thegither an skailin ower wull be gien tae yis. Fer tha misure yis gie ïs tha same misure that wull be misured bak oot tae yis."
An Jesus spauk a parable tae thaim: "Can tha blin lead tha blin? Wull the’ no baith faa ïntae tha sheuch?
A follaer ïs no abain hïs taicher, but whaniver he ïs weel lairnt, he wull be jist laik hïs taicher.
An why dae ye see tha skelf ïn yer brither’s ee, but ye dïnnae see tha plenk ïn yer ain ee?

Hoo can ye say tae yer brither, 'Cum here brither, let me tak tha skelf oot o yer ee', an yit ye cannae see tha plenk ïn yer ain ee? Ye oul hippycrit ye, pu tha plenk oot o yer ain ee furst, an then ye’ll be able tae see proper, tae tak tha skelf oot o yer brither’s ee!
A guid tree daesnae gie rotten fruit, ner daes a rotten tree gie guid fruit.
Ye know iverie tree bi ïts ain fruit. Ye dïnnae pïck fïgs frae a thoarn büsh ner grapes frae a blekberrie büsh.
A guid man brïngs guid oot o tha guidness stored ïn hïs hairt, an a evil man brïngs evil oot o tha evil ïn hïs hairt. Fer whutiver hïs hairt ïs fu o, that’s whut cums oot o hïs mooth.
An why caa me 'Loard, Loard', an no dae whut A say?
Whaiver cums tae me an hears these wurds o mine an heeds thaim, A’ll show ye whut he ïs laik.
He’s laik a man that bigged hïs hoose, an dug deep an set tha fïttins on a roak, an whaniver tha rïver wus ïn fu spate an swep agin tha hoose, ït cudnae shïft ït, fer ït wus set on a roak.
But tha yin that hears whut A say an daesnae dae ït, ïs laik a man that bigged hïs hoose wi nae fundations ava, an whaniver tha flood hut ït, tha hale hoose brauk apairt at yinst."
Whan Jesus haed daen taakin tae tha fowk, he gaed ïntae Capernaum.
Thair wus thïs centurion thonner haed a sarvin man he thocht weel o, that wus seeck an deein.
Whan he heerd tell o Jesus, he axt some eldèrs o tha Jews tae fin oot ïf Jesus wud cum an mak tha sarvin man weel agane.

Whan the’ cum tae Jesus, the’ kep beggin hïm, sayin, "Ye shud dae sumthin fer thïs man, fer he wus tarrible fand o us Jews, an he even bigged a Meetin Hoose fer iz. He desarves ye tae dae thïs fer hïm."
Sae Jesus gan awa wi thaim.
Whan he wus nearhan tha hoose, tha centurion sent freens oot fer tae tell hïm: "Loard, dïnnae bother cumin onie neardèr, fer A’m no fït tae hae ye cum unnèr ma ruif.
It’s no fer tha laiks o me tae cum tae you. But jist say tha wurd, an ma sarvin man wull be weel agane.
Fer A ken hoo tae tak oardèrs; A hae sodgers unnèr me as weel. A tell yin tae gang an he gangs, an anither yin tae cum, an he cums. A tell ma sarvin man, 'Dae thïs!' an he daes ït."
Whan Jesus heerd thïs, he wus astoondit at hïm, an he turnt roon tae tha crood cumin eftèr hïm an saed, "A’m tellin ye, A niver fun oniebodie wi sitch faith ïn aa Israel."
Whan tha freens that wur sent oot cum bak tae tha centurion’s hoose, the’ fun tha sarvin man weel agane.
Tha nixt day, Jesus went tae a toon caad Nain. Hïs follaers an a bïg crood o fowk cum alang wi hïm.
Whan he cum near tha gate ïntae tha toon, ït happent that the’ wur cairryin oot a deid man, a weeda wumman’s ainlie sinn. An a bïg crood wus follaein hir oot frae tha toon.
Whan tha Loard lukt at hir, he tuk peetie on hir, an he toul hir, "Dïnnae greet".
He cum ower an püt hïs han on tha coffin, an tha yins that wur cairtin ït stapt. He saed, "Cum on, young man, up ye get!"
Tha deid man sut up an stairtit tae taak, an Jesus gien hïm bak tae hïs mither.
The’ wur aa hairt scarred, an the’ praised God, sayin, "A pooerfu proaphit haes ris up frae amang iz. God haes cum tae halp hïs fowk oot."
Whut Jesus daen that day wus tha taak o tha hale o Judea an aa tha kintrie roon aboot.
Jhone heerd aboot aa thïs frae hïs follaers.
An he caad fer twa o thaim an sent thaim tae tha Loard fer tae ax, "Wud you be tha Yin that wus supposed tae cum, or shud we be lukkin oot fer some ither bodie?' "
The’ cum tae Jesus an saed, "Jhone tha Baptiser sent iz tae ax ye, 'Ir you tha Yin that wus supposed tae cum?
At that oor, Jesus made a lock o seeck fowk weel agane frae thair ailments. He rïd thaim o ïll spïrits, an he made fowk that wur blin able tae see agane.

He toul Jhone’s follaers, "Gang bak an gie Jhone an accoont o whut ye hae saen an heerd. Blin fowk can see noo, lameters can waak, fowk wi leprosie ir makkit weel. Deef fowk can hear. Tha deid leeve agane. An tha Guid News ïs praicht tae tha puir.
An blisst ïs tha yin that daesnae misdoot me."

Whan Jhone’s messengers went awa, Jesus stairtit tae taak tae tha croods aboot Jhone. He axt thaim, "Whut dïd ye gang oot ïntae tha wuldèrness fer tae see? Wus ït tae see tha rushes sweein ïn tha wun?
If no, whut dïd ye thïnk ye wud see oot thair? A man aa rigged oot ïn fancie claes? Na, fowk that’s weel dresst an leevin ït up, ït's ïn kïngs’ palaces ye wull fin them.
Sae whut dïd yis gae oot fer tae see? Wus ït a proaphit? Aye, A tell ye, an faur mair ner a proaphit.
Thïs ïs tha yin tha Scrïptures taak aboot whaniver the' say: 'Lïsten, A’ll senn oot ma messenger aheid o ye; he wull mak readie tha wye afore ye.'
A tell ye, thair wus niver a bettèr man boarn o a wumman ner Jhone, an yit tha yin that ïs least ïn tha Kïngdom o God ïs a bettèr man ner hïm."
(Aa tha fowk, even tha tex men, whaniver the’ haed heerd thïs, the’ knowed fer sartin God’s wye wus richt, fer the’ haed bin baptised bi Jhone.
But tha Pharisees an tha laayers haednae hoult wi God’s plan fer thaim. They haednae bin baptised bi Jhone.)
Jesus axt thaim, "Whut wull A say aboot tha fowk noo-a-days? Whut kine o fowk ir the’?
The’ ir laik weans sïttin doon at tha mairket, caain oot tae yin anither, 'We played tha whustle fer ye, an ye wudnae daunce. We sung a dirge tae ye, an ye wudnae greet.'
Fer Jhone tha Baptiser wusnae ïntae aitin breid ner drïnkin wine whaniver he cum, an ye say, 'Thair’s a baad spïrit ïn hïm.'
But tha Sinn o Man cum aitin an drïnkin, an ye say, 'Wud ye luk at hïm, he’s a glutton, an fand o tha drïnk so he ïs, tha freen o tex men an wrangdaers!'
But whan fowk daes whut’s richt, the’ prove tha wusdom o God’s wyes."
Noo yin o tha Pharisees axt Jesus fer hïs dennèr, sae Jesus went hame wi hïm fer a bite tae ait an tuk hïs place at tha boord.
An thair wus thïs wumman wi a baad name aboot tha toon, an whaniver she heerd that Jesus wus aitin at tha Pharisee’s hoose, she brocht a wee crock o scent wi hir,
an as she wus behin hïm greetin, hir tears stairtit tae faa on Jesus’s feet. Tha wumman dryed hïs feet wi tha hair o hir heid, an kïsst thaim as she poored tha scent ower thaim.

Noo whaniver tha Pharisee that haed axt hïm tae cum saen thïs, he thocht tae hissel: "If thïs man wus a proaphit, he shud a kent whut soart o a wumman thïs ïs that toucht hïm. He shud a knowed she’s a baad wumman."
Jesus toul hïm, "A want tae tell ye sumthin, Simon." Simon saed, "Maistèr, whut hae ye tae tell me?"
Thair wus thïs man, saed Jesus, "that wud hae lent siller tae fowk. An twa men owed hïm. Tha yin owed hïm five hunnèr siller coins, an tha ither owed hïm fïftie.
Noo whan nane o tha twa haed eneuch siller tae pye hïm bak, tha money-lender toul thaim ït wus aa richt, an he lut thaim aff. Whut yin o thaim, dae ye thïnk, wud laik hïm tha maist?"
Simon saed, "Tha yin that he lut aff that owed hïm tha maist, A suppose." Says Jesus, "Aye, that’s richt. Ye hae saed ït."

Then Jesus lukt ower at tha wumman an saed tae Simon, "Dae ye see thïs wumman? A cum ïntae yer hoose, an ye niver gien me onie wattèr fer ma feet. But she haes waasht ma feet wi hir tears, an dichtit thaim wi hir hair.
Ye dïdnae show that ye wur gled tae see me bi giein me a kïss, but thïs wumman haesnae stapt kïssin ma feet sin A cum ïn!
Ye niver even thocht o pittin a drap o oyle on ma heid, but thïs wumman haes poored scent aa ower ma feet.
A tell ye, hir monie wrangdaeins haes bin forgien, fer she haes showed that much love tae me. Tha yin that haes bin forgien a wee bït, wull onlie love a wee bït."
An Jesus saed tae tha wumman, "Yer wrangdaeins ir forgien."
Tha ither fowk thair at tha table stairtit tae taak amang thairsels, sayin, "Whut kine o man ïs thïs, that can e’en forgie wrangdaeins?"
Then Jesus saed tae tha wumman, "Yer faith haes saved ye. Gang weel!"
Eftèr thïs, Jesus trevelt roon aa tha toons an vïllages, praichin an tellin o tha Guid News o tha Kïngdom o God, an tha twal wus wi hïm.
Forbye, thair wur sartin weemen that haed bin cured o wïckit spïrits an ailments. Thair wus Mary, caad Magdalene; seiven ïll spïrits cum oot o hir,
an Johanna, tha guidwife o Chuza that run Herod’s hoose, an Susanna, an monie mair that wur ay giein whut the’ haed tae luk eftèr Jesus.
Noo a wile thrang o fowk cum frae toon eftèr toon tae gether roon hïm, an he toul thaim thïs parable:

Thair wus thïs fairmer went oot tae saa seed, an as he wus skailin ït, some drapt doon alang tha pad, an ït got waakit iver, an tha wile burds pickt ït up. 
LUK.8.6	Some faad on roakie grun, an ït wus nae shuiner abraird, tae ït wuthert awa fer want o wattèr. 
LUK.8.7	An some faad doon amang thoarns an breers, an tha thoarns sprung up, tuk ower, an chokt ït. 
LUK.8.8	An ither seed faad on guid grun, an ït growed weel, an tha hairvest wus guid, aboot a hunnèr times mair than wus saad. Whan he haed toul thaim aa thïs, he caad oot, "Let hïm that haes ears ïn hïs heid tak tent!"
An hïs follaers axt, "Whut’s thïs parable aboot?"

An he saed tae thaim, "Tae you God haes gien an unnèrstannin o tha secrets o hïs Kïngdom. But tae tha ithers A taak ïn parables: these fowk micht ay be lukkin, but the’ niver see; an ay lïstenin, but the’ niver unnèrstan.
Noo here’s tha mainin o tha parable: Tha seed ïs tha wurd o God.
Tha seed nixt tha pad ïs tha fowk that hears tha wurd. An alang cums tha Deil, an taks ït oot o thair hairts, sae that the’ ir stapt frae believin an cannae be saved.

Tha seed on tha roak ïs tha yins that gledlie gie ear til God’s wurd an tak ït ïn, but ït haes nae ruit an daesnae houl wi thaim. Fer whan haird times cum alang, the’ gie up an the’ hae nae mair mine o ït.

An tha seed amang tha thoarns ïs laik fowk that hears tha wurd o God, an the' cairrie on fer a weethin; but ïn tha enn, aa tha warl’s bothers, catter an guid times staps thaim growin up strecht an sonsie.
But tha seed that faad on tha guid grun, that’s tha fowk wi warthie an guid hairts, that gie ear til tha wurd o God, then tak ït ïntae thair hairts, an follae on tae the’ reap a rich hairvest.
Naebodie lichts a lamp an pits a jar ower ït, or pits ït unnèr a bed. Ye set ït oot whar fowk can see ït whan the’ cum ïn.
Fer thair’s naethin hïd, that wull no be toul; an thair’s naethin püt awa, that wull no be brocht oot ïntae tha apen.
Mine hoo ye lïsten. Fer hïm that haes plentie wull be gien mair. An hïm that haes little, even whut he’ thïnks he haes wull be tuk awa frae hïm.
Noo Jesus’ mither an hïs brithers cum tae see hïm, but the’ cudnae get near tae hïm fer aa tha crood o fowk.
Jesus wus toul, "Yer mither an brithers ir waitin ootbye, lukkin tae see ye."
But he cum bak wi, "Ma mither an ma brithers ir tha yins that lïsten tae tha Wurd o God, an follae ït!"
Yin day, Jesus got ïntae a bóat wi hïs follaers, an he saed tae thaim: "Let’s gang ower tae tha ither side o tha loch. Sae the’ püt oot.
Noo while the’ wur oot on tha wattèr, Jesus lay doon fer a sleep. An ït begun tae get wile stoarmie, an tha bóat begun tae tak on wattèr. An ït wus tarrible dangeris.

Hïs follaers went up tae hïm an waakent hïm. "Dominie, dominie!" the’ caad oot, "we’ll be droont!" An Jesus ris, an he chackt tha blowstèrin wun an waves. Aa at yinst tha wun drapt, an tha stoarm wus ower.
Whar ïs yer faith? he axt thaim. An the’ wur feart, an wunnèrt, an saed tae yin anither: "Whut kine o a man ïs thïs, that can mak e’en tha wun an tha waves dae as he bïds thaim!"
Jesus an hïs follaers cum tae tha lan whar tha Gerasenes leeved, strecht ower tha loch frae Galilee.

Whan he wus gettin oot o tha bóat, thair wus thïs man cum up tae hïm frae tha toon. He wus fu o demons, an haed bin rinnin roon fer a lang time wi naethin on hïm, an leevin ïn tha graveyaird rether than a hoose.
Whan he saen Jesus, he faad at hïs feet an guldèrt, "Whut ïs ït ye ir eftèr wi me, Jesus, sinn o tha maist heich God? A’m beggin ye, quït tormentin me!"
Fer ye see, Jesus haed bïd tha ïll spïrit tae lea hïm alane. Betimes ït haed made hïm brek awa frae hïs girds an tha chains the’ haed bun hïm up wi, an ït haed driv hïm oot ïntae tha wiles.
An Jesus axt hïm, "Whut dae the’ caa ye?" "A’m caad Legion," saed he; fer monie demons haed tuk houl o hïm.
An tha demons kep on beggin Jesus no tae be püt ïntae tha Blek Pït.
Noo a bïg herd o pïgs wus oot hokin fer food on tha braeside, an tha demons begged tae be sent ïntae tha pïgs. An Jesus allood ït.
Sae tha demons cum oot o Legion, an the’ went ïntae tha pïgs. Tha herd tuk aff doon tha hïll, heid furst ïntae tha loch, an tha hale lock wus droont.
An whaniver tha yins that wur lukkin eftèr tha pïgs saen whut haed happent, the’ run aff an toul iveriebodie ïn tha toon an kintrie roon aboot.

An tha fowk that heerd cum oot tae see fer thairsels. An whan the’ cum tae Jesus, the’ fun tha man tha demons haed cum oot o. Legion wus sïttin thair quait at tha feet o Jesus. He haed hïs claes on, an wus ïn hïs richt mine. An the’ wur wile scarred.
An thaim that haed saen tha healin o tha man wi tha demons, toul tha ithers aa aboot ït.
An aa tha fowk frae tha lan o tha Gadarenes
Tha man tha demons went oot o besocht Jesus that he cud gae alang wi hïm, but Jesus toul hïm tae lea, an saed,
Gang awa hame, an tell tha fowk aboot tha great thïngs God haes daen fer ye.
Sae tha man went hame, an he toul tha hale toon whut Jesus haed daen fer hïm.
Noo whaniver Jesus cum bak, a crood o fowk bïd hïm walcum, fer the’ wur aa waitin on hïm.
Then a man caad Jairus, a heidyin o tha Meetin Hoose, cum an faad doon at Jesus’ feet, beggin wi hïm tae cum tae hïs hoose,
fer hïs ainlie dochtèr, a wee lass o twal yeir oul, wus deein.
But as Jesus wus gaun thair, tha thrang wus croodin roon hïm.
An thair wus thïs wumman amang thaim that haed bother wi bleedin fer twal yeir, but naebodie cud dae oniethin fer hir.
She cum ahint Jesus, an she toucht tha enn o hïs cloke, an strecht awa tha bleedin stapt.
Wha toucht me? axt Jesus. Whan naebodie owned up tae ït, Petèr saed, "Dominie, fowk ir püshin an a shuvin aa roon ye [an ye ir wunnèrin wha toucht ye?!].
Saed Jesus: "Summodie haes toucht me! Fer A felt tha pooer gang oot o me!"
Tha wumman, seein that she cudnae hide, cum an faad doon afeart an trèmmlin at hïs feet. An afore tha hale fowk, she toul whut fer she haed toucht hïm, an hoo she haed bin makkit weel at yinst.
Then Jesus saed, "Dochtèr, yer faith haes healt ye.
Tha wurds wusnae richt aff Jesus’ tung, whan thïs man cum frae tha hame o tha heidyin o tha Meetin Hoose, an saed tae hïm: "Jairus, yer dochtèr ïs deid; dïnnae bother tha maistèr onie mair."
Whan Jesus heerd thïs, he toul hïm: "Dïnnae be feart! Jist believe, an she wull be makkit weel!"
An whan Jesus cum tae tha hoose, tha yins he allood tae cum ïn wi hïm wur Petèr, Jhone an Jeames, alang wi tha faither an mither o tha wee lass.
Noo the’ wur aa greetin an wailin fer hir, but Jesus saed, "Be quait! She’s no deid, she’s jist sleepin."
An the’ stairtit tae lach, fer the’ kent she wus deid.
Hooaniver, Jesus tuk hir bi tha han an caad oot: "Cum on chile, up ye git!"
An hir spïrit cum bak, an at yinst she got up. An he toul thaim tae gie hir sumthin tae ait.
Tha mither an faither cudnae believe thair een. But Jesus toul thaim on nae accoont tae say tae oniebodie whut haed happent.
Eftèr Jesus caad hïs twal follaers thegither, he gien thaim pooer iver aa tha demons, an pooer tae cure aa kines o disaises.
An he sent thaim oot tae praich tha Kïngdom o God an tae heal tha seeck.
An he toul thaim, "Tak naethin wi ye fer tha róad, nether stav tae studie ye, ner baag tae cairrie ocht ïn, ner breid, ner siller, an nae spare claes.
Whan ye gang ïntae a hoose, stap ower thair tae ït’s time tae tak yer lave o that toon.
An whar ye’r no walcum, ye’r tae lea that toon, an ye'r tae dicht aff e’en tha stour o yer feet, as a warnin tae thaim.
An aff the’ went, gaun frae vïllage tae vïllage, praichin tha Guid News an healin thair an thonner.
Noo whan Herod tha Tetrarch heerd aboot aa tha thïngs that Jesus wus daein, he wus fare fasht, acause some fowk saed that Jhone tha Baptiser haed ris frae tha deid.
Some thocht that yin o tha oul-time proaphits haed cum bak tae life, an ithers thocht ït wus mebbe Elijah.
But Herod saed, "A haed tha heid tuk aff Jhone. But wha’s thon A’m hearin sitch thïngs aboot?" An he wus ower enxious tae see Jesus.
An tha possels, whan the’ cum bak, toul Jesus aboot aa tha thïngs the’ haed daen, an he tuk thaim aff bi thair lane tae a [quait place near tha] toon caad Bethsaida.
But tha croods kent thïs an follaed hïm. An he bïd thaim walcum an taakt tae thaim o tha Kïngdom o God, an brocht healin tae thaim that haed need o ït.

Noo at dailygan, tha Twal cum tae hïm an saed, "Senn aa tha croods o fowk awa, sae that the’ can gang an fin lüdgins an a bite tae ait fer thairsels ïn tha clachans an fairm hooses roon aboot. Fer we’r ïn a richt oot o tha wye place here."
But Jesus toul thaim, "Yous gie thaim sumthin tae ait." An the’ saed, "We hae naethin but five bannocks an twa fïsh. Or mebbe we shud try an buy sumthin fer aa these fowk?!"
Thair wur aboot five thoosan men. An Jesus saed tae hïs follaers, "Mak thaim aa sït doon ïn groups o aboot fïftie."
Sae the’ bïd thaim aa sït doon.
Then he tuk tha five bannocks an tha twa fïsh, an lukkin up tae heiven he blisst ït an brauk ït, an he kep giein ït tae hïs follaers tae han oot tae aa tha fowk.
Eftèr the’ haed aa et thair fïll, the’ gethert up aa tha wee bïts, eneuch tae fïll twal creels.
Yin day Jesus wus prayin alane, tha mair hïs follaers wus nearhan. An he axt thaim, "Wha dae tha croods say that A am?"
The’ saed, "A wheen o fowk say Jhone tha Baptiser, some wud say Elijah, an ithers agane say that yin o tha proaphits frae lang syne haes cum bak tae life."
An what aboot yersels? he axt. "Wha dae you say that A am?" Petèr spake up, "You ir tha Christ o God."
An he gien thaim a warnin, an bïd thaim no tae tell oniebodie.

An he toul thaim, "Tha Sinn o Man maun suffer monies a thïng an be gien tha coul shoodèr bi tha eldèrs, tha heid preeshts an tha maistèrs o tha Laa. An he maun be püt tae deith an be ris up tae life on tha thurd day."
An he saed tae thaim aa, "If oniebodie wants tae follae eftèr me, he maun ferget aboot hissel aathegither, tak up hïs cross iverie day, an stïck clase tae me.
Fer whaiver wants tae save hïs life wull loass ït, but hïm that loasses hïs life on accoont o me wull save ït.
Fer whut guid ïs ït fer a bodie tae hae tha hale warl, an yit desthroy hissel bodie an sowl?
Fer ïf oniebodie ïs no wullin tae stan up fer me an ma wurds, then tha Sinn o Man wull no stan up fer hïm whan he cums ïn hïs glorie, an tha glorie o hïs Faither an tha halie angels tae.
A’m tellin ye strecht, thair’s yins stud here theday that fer sartain wull no dee afore the’ see tha Kïngdom o God."
Yin day, aboot echt days eftèr he haed saed these thïngs, he tuk Petèr, Jeames an Jhone up ïntae a muntin tae pray.
An whaniver he wus prayin, tha hale luk o hïm wus changed, an hïs claes wur glancin white turnt.
An then thair wus these twa men taakin wi hïm - ït wus Moses an Elijah,
fu o heivenlie splendour, an the’ taakt aboot tha wye he wud dee ïn Jerusalem.
But Petèr an tha ithers wi hïm haed drapt aff tae sleep, an whan the’ wakt up the’ saa hïs glorie an tha twa men stannin wi hïm.
An as tha twa men wus leain Jesus, Petèr saed, "Dominie, A’m gled we ir here tae see thïs. Cum on an we’ll big thrie shiltèrs, yin fer you, yin fer Moses an yin fer Elijah." But he wus jist rannèrin.
Whan Petèr wus taakin, a clood cum doon an the’ wur loast ïn ït. An the’ wur hairt scarred whan that happent.
An a voice cum oot o tha clood sayin, "Thïs ïs ma Sinn, tha Yin A hae chose. Lïsten tae hïm!"
Whan tha voice haed stapt taakin, the’ lukt an thair wus nae yin thair but Jesus. An at tha time, the’ dïdnae breathe a wurd o whut the’ haed saen tae onie yin.
Nixt day, whan the’ haed cum doon aff tha hïll, a hale crood o fowk cum tae meet hïm,
an thïs man caad oot frae tha crood, "Maistèr, A beg ye, plaise tak a luk at ma sinn! He’s tha ainlie chile A hae.
An a wïckit spïrit ïs ay takkin houl o hïm, sae he lets oot a guldèr, an he taks a fït an stairts foamin at tha mooth, an onlie eftèr he’s bin hurt baad daes ït lea hïm.
A brocht hïm tae yer follaers tae rïd hïm o tha spïrit, but the’ cudnae dae ït."
An Jesus saed, "You fowk ir faithless an aisie led! Hoo lang wull A be wi ye afore yis believe? Hoo lang dae A hae tae pit up wi ye? Brïng yer sinn here tae me!"
Jist as tha wee lad wus cumin, he faad doon tae tha grun fïttin, an Jesus gien tha wïckit spïrit a richt barjin, an healt tha wee lad an gien hïm bak tae hïs faither.
The’ wur aa pure dumfoonèrt at tha pooer o God.
But whiles the’ aa wunnèrt at tha thïngs Jesus dïd, he saed tae hïs follaers,
Wull yis tak heed tae whut A’m sayin, an let ït sink ïn: tha Sinn o Man ïs gaun tae be pit ïntae tha pooer o men.
But the’ dïdnae unnèrstan whut he wus sayin an cudnae fethom ït oot; yit the’ wur feart tae ax hïm whut he meent.
Then the’ begun queeryin amang thairsels wha wud be tha maist thocht o amang thaim.
An Jesus, knowin whut the' wur thïnkin, tuk a wean an set hïm doon aside hïm.

An he saed tae thaim, "Whaiver maks thïs chile walcum ïn ma name, walcums me, an oniebodie that walcums me, walcums hïm that sent me. Tha yin regairdit o nae accoont amang ye, that’s tha yin that’ll hae tha maist honour."
Jhone saed tae hïm, "Dominie, we saa a bodie drivin oot demons ïn your name an we made hïm stap, fer he ïsnae yin o us."
But Jesus saed, "Dae nae sitch thïng, fer oniebodie that’s no agin ye ïs wi ye."
An as tha time wus cumin roon fer Jesus tae lea tha irth, he set hissel tae gang up tae Jerusalem.
An he sent some messengers on up aheid o hïm, an the’ went aff tae a Samaritan vïllage fer tae mak readie fer hïs cumin.
But tha fowk thonner wudnae mak hïm walcum, acause the’ cud see he wus bent on gaun tae Jerusalem.
Whaniver Jeames an Jhone heerd thïs, the’ saed, "Loard, let iz caa doon fire frae heiven an burn thaim aa up, [jist as Elijah dïd.]"
But Jesus toul thaim aff, [an saed, "Ye hae nae unnèrstannin ava,
Fer tha Sinn o Man haesnae cum tae desthroy men’s lives, but tae save thaim."] Sae the’ went on tae anither vïllage.
An sae ït wus, as the’ wur on thair wye, thïs bodie saed tae Jesus, "Loard, A wull follae ye, nae mettèr whar ye’r fer!"
Saed Jesus tae hïm, "Foxes hae holes an burds hae nests, but tha Sinn o Man haes naewhar he can caa hame."
An he saed tae anither yin, "Follae me". But he saed, "Loard, let me gang an burie ma faither furst."
But Jesus saed bak tae hïm, "Let tha deid burie thair ain deid, but awa you gang an praich tha Kïngdom o God."
An yit anither yin saed, "Loard, A’ll follae ye, but let me gang an say aa ma guidbyes tae ma fowk bak hame."
But Jesus toul hïm, "Oniebodie that stairts tae ploo, an keeps lukkin behin hïm, ïs nae guid tae tha Kïngdom o God."
Eftèr aa thïs, tha Loard caad oot seiventie mair follaers an sent thaim oot aheid o hïm, twa bi twa, tae aa tha toons an places whar he wus gaun tae vïsit hissel.
An he saed tae thaim, "Thair’s a gran hairvest waitin, but thair’s no monie warkers tae gether ït ïn. Sae keep on axin tha Loard o tha hairvest tae senn oot mair warkers ïntae hïs hairvest fiel.
Noo, awa yis gang, but mine ye, A’m sennin yis oot laik lambs amang wolfs.
Dïnnae cairrie a pooch ner a baag, ner e’en spare shune, an dïnnae stap tae blether wi oniebodie on tha róad.
Whutiver hoose yis gang ïntae, say furst, 'God bliss thïs hoose wi peace.'
If thair’s peace-lovin fowk thair, yer blissin wull bide wi thaim; an ïf thair ïsnae onie, yer blissin wull cum bak tae ye.
Stap ïn tha yin hoose, an ait an drïnk whut the’ set afore ye, fer a warker ïs warth hïs wages. Dïnnae flit aboot frae hoose tae hoose.
An whaniver yis gang ïntae a toon, ïf the’ bïd yis walcum, ait aa the’ set afore ye.
An heal tha seeck fowk thair, an say tae thaim, 'Tha Kïngdom o God haes cum nearhan ye.'
But ïf ye gang ïntae a toon an the’ dïnnae bïd ye walcum, gang oot ïntae tha raas an tell thaim,
'E’en tha stour o yer toon that clegs oor feet, we dicht ït aff as a warnin tae ye, but we’ll hae ye know that tha Kïngdom o God haes cum nearhan ye.'
A tell ye, tha fowk o Sodom wull be bettèr aff on tha Day o Reckonin ner that toon.

Sorra tae Chorazim, an sorra tae Bethsaida, fer ïf tha fowk o Tyre an Sidon haed saen tha warkin o God’s pooer as yous hae saen ït, the’ wud hae repentit lang syne, an sut doon ïn seckclaith an eshes.
Hooaniver, tha fowk o Tyre an Sidon wull be bettèr aff on tha Day o Reckonin than yous wull.
An Capernaum, you micht thïnk ye’r weel on yer wye tae heiven. Na, but A’m tellin ye, ye’ll be brocht doon tae hell."

Then he saed tae hïs follaers, "Whaiver lïstens tae yous ïs lïstenin tae me, an whaiver turns hïs bak on you, turns hïs bak on me; an whaiver turns hïs bak on me, turns hïs bak on tha Yin that sent me."
Whan tha seiventie cum bak, the’ wur hairt gled an toul Jesus, "Loard, even tha ïll spïrits haed tae dae whut we bïd thaim ïn yer name!"
An he saed tae thaim, "A saa Satan faain frae heiven laik a flesh o lichtnin.
Luk noo, A hae gien yis tha thortie tae thramp on snakes an scorpions an tae owercum tha pooer o Satan yer enemie. Thair’s naethin wull be able tae dae yis onie hairm.
Nanethaless, haein pooer ower ïll spïrits ïs no tha thïng tae be gled aboot, but rether be gled that yer names ïs writ doon ïn heiven."

An thair an then Jesus wus owercum wi tha joy o tha Halie Spïrit, an he caad oot: "Faither, Loard o heiven an irth, A praise ye that ye hae kep these thïngs frae clivir an warlie-wise fowk, an made thaim clear eneuch fer weans tae unnèrstan. Aye, Faither, ït haes plaised ye tae dae ït thïs wye.

Ma Faither haes gien aa thïngs ower tae me, an naebodie kens wha tha Sinn raelie ïs apairt frae tha Faither, an naebodie fu kens tha Faither apairt frae tha Sinn, an whaiver tha Sinn wants tae reveal hïm tae."
An whan Jesus wus on hïs ain wi hïs follaers, he turnt tae thaim an saed, "Blisst ir tha een that see whut ye see.
A’ll tell ye thïs, thair's monie proaphits an kïngs wud hae likt tae see whut yous see, an the' dïdnae see ït; an tae hear whut yous hear, but the' dïdnae hear ït."
Yin day a thortie on tha Laa stud up an axt Jesus a question tae pit hïm tae tha test: "Maistèr, whut can A dae tae be shair A’ll hae iverlastin life?"
An Jesus saed bak tae hïm: "Whut daes tha Laa o Moses say? Whut’s yer unnèrstannin o ït?"
He answert an saed, "Ye maun love tha Loard yer God wi aa yer hairt, an yer sowl, an yer mine, micht an main; an yer nighber jist as much as yersel."
An Jesus saed tae hïm: "Aye, that’s tha richt answer. Dae thïs an ye’ll leeve."
But he wantit tae keep hissel aheid o tha argyment, an he saed tae Jesus: "Aye, but wha ïs ma nighber?"
An Jesus saed, "Yin time thair wus thïs man trevelin frae Jerusalem tae Jericho an he wus set upon bi robbers, that strïpt hïm o hïs claes an gien hïm a richt hemmerin an left hïm half deid.
An bi chance a preesht cum alang, an whan he saen hïm he slïpt bye on tha ither side o tha róad.
An eftèr thïs a Levite
Then a Samaritan treveler cum tae whar he wus, an whan he saen hïm, hïs hairt went oot tae hïm.
An he went ower tae hïm an rowlt up hïs sairs, poorin on oyle an wine tae aise thaim, an sut hïm on hïs ain baist an brocht hïm tae an ïnn an lukt eftèr hïm.
Tha nixt moarnin, whan he wus leain, he tuk oot twa siller coins an gien thaim tae tha ïnnkeeper an saed, 'Tak guid care o hïm an ïf ye ir oot o poaket, A’ll mak ït up tae ye whan A cum bak.' "
Saed Jesus: "Noo, whutch o these thrie wus nighber tae tha bodie that got tha hemmerin frae tha robbers?"
An tha laayer saed, "Tha yin that tuk peetie on hïm." Then Jesus saed, "You gang awa an dae tha same."
As Jesus an hïs follaers waakit on, the’ cum tae a vïllage an a wumman caad Mairtha walcumed hïm ïntae hir hame.
She haed a sïstèr, Mary, that settelt hirsel doon at hïs feet an hung on iverie wurd he haed tae say.
But Mairtha wus aa o a floostèr ower aa that needit tae be daen, an she saed, "Loard, can ye no see ma sïstèr haes left me tae dae aa tha wark, tell hir tae cum an gie iz a han."
An Jesus answert, "Och Mairtha, ye ir gettin yersel aa warkt up aboot a hale lock o thïngs ye see need daen,
but onlie yin thïng raelie mettèrs. Mary haes waaled whut’s best, an ït’ll no be taen awa frae hir."
Yinst, whan Jesus wus oot prayin, yin o hïs follaers saed tae hïm, eftèr he haed quït, "Loard, lairn iz hoo tae pray, jist tha wye Jhone dïd wi hïs follaers."
An he saed tae thaim, "Whan ye pray, say:
'[Oor] Faither [that bides Abain],
Halie be yer name.
Micht yer Kïngdom cum shuin,
[An yer wull be daen on irth,
jist tha wye ït ïs Abain.]
Gie iz theday eneuch breid tae dae iz.
An forgie iz oor wrangdaeins,
laik we forgie thaim
that daes wrang agin us.
An dïnnae róad iz ïntae temptation,
[but save iz frae aa ïll

Then Jesus saed tae thaim, "Sayin ye went tae a freen’s hoose ïn tha mïddle o tha nicht an saed tae hïm, 'Cud A borra thrie loafs o breid, acause a freen o mine haes cum tae vïsit an thair’s nae mait ïn tha hoose. An sayin tha freen caas oot, 'Dïnnae bother me, tha dure’s lockt an me an tha weans ïs ïn bed. A’m no gettin up tae gie ye oniethin!'
Even he daesnae get up an gie hïm whut he’s lukkin, ïf ye keep on knockin lang eneuch, he’ll rise an gie hïm aa he needs.
An A say: Keep on axin, an ït wull be gien tae ye, keep on lukkin an ye’ll fin whut ye’r eftèr, keep on rappin an tha dorr wull be apent tae ye.
Fer iveriebodie that axes wull get; hïm that keeps on lukkin wull fin whut he’s eftèr; an tae hïm that keeps on rappin, tha dorr wull be apent.
If a sinn axes breid frae onie o yis that’s a faither, wull he gie hïm a stane; or ïf he axes a fïsh wull he gie hïm a snake?
Or ïf he axes an egg wud he offer hïm a scorpion?
An sae ïf sïnfu fowk laik yersels know hoo tae gie guid thïngs tae yer weans, hoo much mair wull yer heivenlie Faither gie tha Halie Spïrit tae thaim that axes hïm!"
Yinst, Jesus wus castin oot a dum spïrit frae a man. An whaniver tha demon left hïm an tha man that wus dum stairtit tae taak, tha fowk wur dumfoonèrt.
But some o thaim saed, 'He casts demons oot throu tha pooer o Beelzebub, tha heidyin o tha demons.'
But ithers tried tae ketch hïm oot bi axin fer a sign frae heiven.
An He, knowin’ whut wus ïn thair mines saed, "A kïngdom divïd agin ïtsel wull gae tae reck an ruin, an a hoose divïd agin ïtsel wull faa doon.
Sae ïf Satan ïs divïd agin hissel, hïs kïngdom cudnae stan, cud ït? Hoo then can ye say that A cast oot demons throu tha pooer o Beelzebub?
If yis say that A cast oot ïll spïrits bi tha pooer o Beelzebub, bi whut pooer then daes yer ain fowk cast thaim oot? Sae let thaim be tha yins tae judge ye fer whut ye hae saed.
But ïf A, wi tha fïng’r o God cast oot ïll spïrits, ït proves that tha Kïngdom o God ïs here amang ye.
Whaniver a strang man wha’s weel-airmed gairds hïs castle, hïs belangins ïs safe.
But whaniver a strang’r man attecks an gets tha bettèr o hïm, he taks awa aa tha armour he lippens on, an tha belangins ïs aa divïd oot.
Hïm that’s no for me ïs agin me; an hïm that ïsnae giein me a han tae gether ïn, he micht as weel be scaatèrin.

Whan an ïll spïrit cums oot o a man, ït raiks throu tha desert lukkin fer rest, an whan ït daesnae fin onie, ït says, 'A’ll jist gae bak tae whar A wus leevin afore.' Sae tha spïrit gaes bak tae tha hoose ït left an fins ït swep clain an aa redd up. Then ït luks fer seiven ither spïrits mair wïckit ner ïtsel, an the’ aa gae ïn an settle thair. An that man enns up faur waur ner he wus afore."
An while Jesus wus taakin, a wumman ïn tha getherin caad oot, "Blisst ïs tha wumman that gien ye birth an nurst ye as a wean!"
An he saed bak tae hir, "But mair blisst ir tha yins that hear tha wurd o God an heed ït!"

Mair an mair fowk wus jundyin roon hïm, an he begun tae praich tae thaim sayin, "We’r leevin ïn evil times wi evil fowk. The’ keep lukkin fer a sign, but nane wull be gien thaim, apairt frae tha sign o Jonah, tha proaphit.
Fer jist as Jonah wus a sign tae tha Ninevites, ïn tha same wye A, tha Sinn o Man, wull be a sign tae thïs genèration.

Tha Queen o tha Sooth wull stan up on Judgemen Day wi tha men o thïs genèration an she wull condemn thaim, fer she cum frae tha enns o tha irth fer tae lïsten tae Solomon's wusdom. Yit yin abin Solomon ïs here noo, an the'ir no lïstenin!
Tha men o Nineveh wull stan up ïn that Day as weel wi thïs genèration, an the'll condemn ït; fer they repentit whaniver Jonah praicht tae thaim, an yit yin abin Jonah ïs here noo.
Naebodie lichts a lamp an pits ït unnèr a boul fer tae hide ïts licht, but the’ pit ït up on a stan whar aa can see ïts licht.
Yer ee ïs tha lamp o yer bodie, an ïf yer ee ïs guid, yer hale bodie ïs fu o licht; but whan yer ee ïs baad, yer hale bodie’s fu o dairkness.
Noo tha licht ye thïnk ye hae, tak heed that ït’s no dairkness.
An sae ïf ye be aa fu o licht wi nae wee dairk coarners, yer hale bodie wull be a-glowin, laik whan a bricht licht shines on ye."
An while he wus taakin, a Pharisee axt hïm tae hïs hoose fer a bite tae ait, an he went ïn an sut doon.
Tha Pharisee got a gunk whan he saa that Jesus dïdnae waash afore dennèr.
But tha Loard saed tae hïm, "Yous Pharisees waash tha ootside o tha bickers an plates, but inside ye’r fu o greed an wïckitness.
Ye coafs, hae ye no tha sense tae know that God made tha inside as weel as tha ootside?
Gie tae tha puir oot o whut ye hae on yer ain plate, an then ye’ll be clain throu an throu.

Lïsten here, wae faa ye, Pharisees, ye gie a tenth o yer gairden spices sitch as mint an rue, but ye hae neglectit justice, an ye dïnnae love God. But ye shudnae forget tae be fair an kine tae ithers, an tae love God, as weel as giein yer tenth.
Wae faa ye, Pharisees, fer ye ay laik tae hae tha best saits ïn tha Meetin Hooses, ay wantin fowk tae touch thair keps tae ye ïn tha mairket places.
Aye, wae faa ye, [Pharisees, maistèrs o tha Laa an hippycrits], fer yis ir laik graves wi nae mairkins that men waak ower wi’oot knowin."
Then yin o tha laayers saed tae Jesus, "Maistèr, ir ye gettin at us as weel?"
He saed, "Ye’r ïn fer bother tae, yous laayers, fer yis gie men burdens ower wechtie tae cairt, an ye dïnnae lïft a fïng’r yersels tae gie a han.
Wae faa ye, fer yis big fancie monuments on tha graves o tha verie proaphits that yer faithers kïllt lang syne.
Yer faithers kïllt thaim but yous bigged tha monuments, sae ye maun gae alang wi whut the’ daen.
God, then, ïn hïs wusdom saed, 'A wull senn thaim proaphits an possels. The’ wull kïll a wheen o thaim an gie tha rest a haird time.'
Sae tha bluid o aa tha proaphits spïlt frae tha begïnnin o tha warl, yous fowk leevin noo hae ït on yer heids:
frae tha kïllin o Abel tae tha kïllin o Zechariah atween tha althar an tha Hoose o God. Aye, A’m tellin yis, yous’ll pye fer thïs!
Aye, ye’r ïn fer bother tae, yous laayers, fer yis hae taen awa tha key tae unnèrstannin. Yis hinnae uised ït yersels, an yis hae kep ither fowk frae uisin ït as weel."
Whaniver Jesus quït taakin, tha Pharisees an tha maistèrs o tha Laa wus wile ang’rie an heckelt hïm,
tryin tae get hïm tae cum oot wi sumthin that the’ cud fin faut wi, fer tae get hïm arrestit.

Mainwhile thoosans o fowk gethert up sae thrang that the’ wur thrampin yin anither. Jesus spauk furst o aa tae hïs follaers an toul thaim, "Be on yer gaird agin tha yeast o tha Pharisees, fer the’ let on tae be guid an the’r faur frae ït!
Thair’s naethin covert ower that’ll no cum tae licht, ner hïd that’ll no be kent.
Sae, whutiver’s taakt aboot ïn tha dairk wull be heerd ïn braid daylicht, an whut ye hae whuspert aboot behin shut dures wull be blared oot frae tha ruiftaps.
Lïsten freens, dïnnae be feart o thaim that kïll tha bodie, fer eftèr that thair’s naethin mair the’ can dae.
But A’ll warn ye noo wha ye shud fear. Fear hïm that haes tha pooer tae kïll, an then tae throw ïntae hell. Aye, A tell ye, fear hïm!
Shair five wee sparras ir soul fer a wheen o happence, ir the’ no? An God daesnae forget onie o thaim.
But even tha verie hairs o yer heid ir aa coontit, sae dïnnae be feart, yis ir warth mair ner a hale wheen o sparras.
An A'm tellin ye, whaiver’s no feart tae tell fowk the’ belang tae me, tha Sinn o Man wull own hïm tae afore tha angels o God.
But oniebodie that daesnae admït tae bein a follaer o mine, wull be denied bi me afore tha angels o God.
An whaiver spakes a wurd agin tha Sinn o Man wull be forgien, but whaiver spakes ïll agin tha Halie Spïrit wull no be forgien.
Whan yis ir brocht afore tha Meetin Hoose offeeshals an heidyins, dïnnae be ower enxious aboot yer answer or whut tae say,
fer tha Halie Spïrit wull pit tha wurds ïn yer mooth whan tha time cums."
An yin o tha crood saed tae hïm, "Maistèr, wud ye hae a wurd wi ma brither, an ax hïm tae share wi me whut wus left tae iz?"
An he saed tae hïm, "Freen, wha gien me tha richt tae settle a dïffernce atween you an yer brither?"
An Jesus saed tae thaim, "Tak heed that yis ir no ay wantin thïngs that ither fowk hae, fer a man’s life ïs no jist a mettèr o whut he gethers aboot hïm."
An he toul thaim thïs parable, "Yin time, a weel tae dae fairmer haed a guid hairvest.
An he swuthered aboot whut he wus gaun tae dae, fer he haed nae ruim tae store ït aa.
Sae he saed tae hissel, 'A ken whut A’ll dae, A’ll tummle ma barns an big yins that’ll houl aa ma grain an guids.
An A’ll say tae masel: A hae plentie left bye me tae dae me fer monie a yeir, sae A’ll jist ait, drïnk an hae a guid time tae masel.'
But God saed, 'Ye ir a fool, fer ye’ll be caad awa thïs verie nicht, an wha’ll get aa tha stuff ye hae left behin?'
In tha same wye tha man’s a fool that gethers up stuff fer hissel, an haesnae stored up tha richt soart o treysure wi God."
An Jesus turnt tae hïs follaers an saed, "A’m tellin ye, yis ir tae tak nae thocht fer yer life or yer bodie, whut tae ait or whut tae pit on ye.
Thair’s mair tae life ner mait an claes.
Luk at tha craws, the’ nether sow ner reap an hae nae barns tae store oniethin ïn, yit the’ get eneuch tae dae thaim, fer God feeds thaim. Ir yous no warth mair tae hïm than a wheen o burds?
Ye cannae add an oor tae yer life bi worryin aboot ït,
sae, ïf ye cannae dae a wee thïng laik that, why worrie yersel aboot oniethin else?
Noo, tak tha lïlies, ye see hoo the’ growe; the’ dïnnae wark an the’ dïnnae spïn, yit A’ll tell ye thïs, e’en Solomon, wi aa hïs fancie claes, cudnae match thaim!
An ïf God pits claes on tha gress ïn tha fiel that’s here theday an throwed ïntae tha fire themorra, dae you dooters no unnèrstan that he’ll luk eftèr you anaa?.
Sae dïnnae worrie aboot mait or drïnk. Dïnnae bother yer heids aboot ït.
It’s thaim as daesnae know God that rin eftèr sitch thïngs, but yer Faither abain kens whut ye hae need o.
But yous ir tae seek oot hïs Kïngdom, an tha ither thïngs wull tak care o thairsels.
Dïnnae be scarred, wee flock, fer yer faither wants tae gie ye tha Kïngdom.
Sell aff whut ye hae an gie tha siller tae tha puir, an thïs wull coont as treysure stored up ïn strang safe moneybaags ïn heiven, whar ït’ll nether be stole bi thiefs ner et wi moths.
Fer whut yis thïnk tha maist o, wull ay be ïn yer hairt.
Be aa dresst up an readie wi tha hoose lït up; ect laik men waitin on thair maistèr tae cum bak frae tha waddin, sae that whan he knocks yis can apen tha dure tae hïm richt awa.
Whaniver tha maistèr cums, blisst ir tha yins he fins watchin an waitin. A tell yis thïs, he’ll get hissel readie, sït thaim doon, an he hissel wull sarve thaim, an lea tha mait oot afore thaim.
Tha maistèr wull mebbe cum bak ïn tha wee smaa oors, or at tha scraich o day, but ïf he fins thaim readie an waitin whaniver he cums, the’ wull be blisst aa richt!
Ye can be shair o thïs: ïf ye haed a hoose, an ye knowed tha day an oor a thief wus cumin, ye’d be lukkin oot fer hïm, wud ye no? Ye wudnae alloo yer hoose tae be brauk ïntae.
Sae yous maun be readie, fer ye dïnnae ken tha oor tha Sinn o Man wull cum."
Then Petèr saed, "Loard, dïd ye main these thïngs fer iveriebodie, or jist fer us?"

An tha Loard saed, "A’m taakin tae onie wise an faithfu sarvint, whase maistèr ïs able tae lea hïm ïn chairge o tha ither sarvints ïn hïs hoose, tae gie iveriebodie thair fair share o mait at tha richt time.
Onie sarvint ectin laik thïs whaniver hïs maistèr cums bak, wull be a happy man.
A’ll tell ye thïs, he’ll pit that sarvint ïn chairge o iveriethin he haes.

But ïf tha sarvint says tae hissel, 'He's a lang time o cumin, tha maistèr', an he aits an gets drunk an he stairts tae bate up aa tha ither sarvints - weel noo, tha maistèr wull cum bak on a day an oor whan he’s no lukkin oot fer hïm, an tha maistèr wull dae awa wi that sarvint. He wull trait hïm jist laik an unbeliever.
An that sarvint that knowed richtlie whut tae dae, an dïdnae dae whut he wus toul bi tha maistèr an mak readie, he’ll get yin guid whalin.

But tha yin that dïd wrang whaniver he dïdnae unnèrstan whut he shud a daen, he’ll get aff aisie, tha mair he daesnae desarve ït. God wull ax a lock frae thaim that’s bin gien a lock. Tha mair the’ hae bin gien tae luk eftèr, tha mair the’ wull hae tae answer fer.
A’m cum tae kïnnle a fire on irth, an A wush ït wus aareadie lït!
A hae a tarrible baptisin aheid o me, an awfu testin tae ït’s aa ower.
Dae ye thïnk A cum tae brïng peace on irth? Deed na, ït’s deveesion A brïng.
Frae noo a hoose wi five fowk wull be divïd, wi thrie agin twa an twa agin thrie.

Tha faither wull be divïd agin tha sinn, an tha sinn agin tha faither; tha mither agin tha dochtèr an tha dochtèr agin tha mither; tha mither-ïn-laa agin tha dochtèr-ïn-laa; an tha dochtèr-ïn-laa agin tha mither-ïn-laa."
An Jesus saed tae tha crood o fowk, "Whaniver ye see cloods cumin ïn frae tha wast, ye ken we’r fer haein rain, an, richt eneuch, doon ït cums!
An whan tha wun blaas frae tha sooth, ye ken we’r ïn fer a scorcher, an sae ït ïs.
Yous hippycrits, yis can read tha luk o tha sky aa richt, but yis cannae see tha signs aa roon aboot ye o whut’s tae cum.
Why dae yis no see fer yersels whut’s richt?

If oniebodie pits tha blame on ye an taks ye tae coort, ye shud dae yer best tae settle tha mettèr oot o coort. If ye dïnnae, then ye’ll be up afore tha judge an he’ll turn ye ower tae tha offysher, an ye’ll enn up ïn jail.
Fer ïf that’s tha wye ït enns up, ye’ll no git oot o thair afore yer last pennie’s pyed!"
At that parteeclar time, Jesus wus toul that Pilate haed kïllt some fowk frae Galilee while the’ wur offerin secryfices ïn tha Hoose o tha Loard.
He saed tae thaim, "Dae ye jalouse tha yins that suffert laik thïs haed daen mair wrang ner aa tha ither Galileeans?
Na, A tell ye thïs, ïf yis dïnnae repent, tha hale lock o yis’ll perish as weel.
Or whut aboot tha echteen that deed ïn Siloam whaniver tha ture cum doon on tap o thaim? Dae ye jalouse that thair wrangdaeins wus waur ner aa tha ither yins ïn Jerusalem?
Na, A tell ye thïs, ïf yis dïnnae repent, tha hale lock o ye wull perish forbye.
Then Jesus toul thaim a parable. "Thair wus thïs man haed a fïg tree plantit ïn hïs vineyaird. Yin day, he cum tae ït tae see ïf thair wus onie fruit on ït, but he fun nane.
Sae he saed tae tha gairdner, 'Luk here, thïs thrie yeir A hae cum lukkin fer fïgs on thïs tree, an thair’s nane on ït! Cut ït doon! It’s a waste o guid grun.'
Tha gairdner saed, 'Lea ït alane, sïr, gie ït anither yeir. A’ll dïg roon ït an gie ït a guid dressin o dung.
If thair’s onie fïgs on ït nixt yeir, weel an guid, an ïf no, we’ll cut ït doon fer ye.' "
Noo, yin Sabbath day, whan Jesus wus taichin ïn yin o tha Meetin Hooses,
thair wus a wumman that haed bin baad fer echteen yeir acause o an ïll spïrit. She wus bent dooble an cudnae stan up strecht ava.
Whan Jesus saa hir, he caad hir an saed tae hir, "Wumman, ye’r redd o yer seeckness, an ye’r noo free!"
An he püt hïs hans on hir, an she stud up hir fu heicht, an gien praise tae God.

But tha heidyin o tha Meetin Hoose wus ang’rie, acause Jesus haed healt tha wumman on tha Sabbath day, an he saed tae tha fowk, "Ye hae sïx days tae dae aa yer wark. Cum tae be healt on yin o thaim days an no on tha Sabbath!"
An thïs ïs hoo tha Loard answert hïm. "Yis oul hippycrits! Shair, dae yis no lowse yer kye an yer cuddies frae tha staal on tha Sabbath, an tak thaim oot tae wattèr thaim?
Wus ït no richt that on tha Sabbath A shud set free thïs wumman o tha femlie o Abraham, that haes bin hel ïn bondage bi Satan thïs echteen yeir?"
Thïs püt hïs enemies tae shame, tha hale lock o thaim; an aa tha fowk wus hairt gled at aa tha wunnèrfu thïngs he daen.
Then Jesus saed, "Fer whut laik ïs tha Kïngdom o God? Wha shud A compare ït wi?
It ïs laik a wee mustèrt seed that a bodie tuk an plantit ïn hïs gairden an ït growed ïntae a tree, an tha wee burds cum an the' tuk shiltèr ïn ïts brenches."
An he saed agane, "Fer whut laik ïs tha Kïngdom o God? Whut shud A compare ït wi?
It’s laik a wee taste o yeast that a wumman pits ïn a bïg boul o flure. An ït spreeds aa throu ït, tae tha hale lock o ït ïs ris."
An he gaed throu tha toons an vïllages, taichin as he went, ay heidin on nixt Jerusalem.
An summodie axt hïm, "Wull thair jist be a wheen o fowk saved, Loard?" An he saed tae thaim aa,

Dae aa ye can tae get ïn bi tha nerra dure. Fer monies a yin wull try an get ïn, an no be fït tae.
