Jist then some Pharisees cum up an saed tae hïm, "Get oot o here ïf ye want tae leeve, fer Herod haes ït ïn mine tae kïll ye!"

Gang tell thon sleekit oul fox, saed Jesus tae thaim, "that 'A’ll be keepin on castin oot ïll spïrits an healin tha seeck theday an themorra. An tha day eftèr that A’ll hae daen whut A wus sent tae dae.'
Nanethaless, theday, themorra an tha nixt day, A maun gang on ma róad, fer ït wudnae dae fer a proaphit o God tae dee ootside o Jerusalem.

O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, ye kïll tha proaphits an stane thaim that’s sent tae ye! Monies tha time A wantit tae gether yer weans thegither, laik a hen gethers hir lachter o wee burds unnèr hir wïngs, but yis wudnae let me!
Luk, yer Hoose ïs empie noo. But A tell ye thïs, yis’ll no see me agane till ye say, 'Blisst ïs tha Yin that cums ïn tha name o tha Loard'!"
Yin Sabbath day, Jesus went fer a bite tae ait at tha hoose o yin o tha heidyins o tha Pharisees, an the’ wur aa keepin thair ee on hïm.
An forenent hïm wus thïs man wi hïs bodie aa swallt up.
Sae Jesus axt tha laayers an Pharisees, "Daes tha Laa alloo ye tae heal fowk on tha Sabbath day, or no?"
The’ haed nae answer tae that. Sae he layed hïs han on tha man, an he healt hïm an sent hïm awa.
An he turnt tae thaim an saed, "Jist say, yin o yis haed a cuddie
The’ cudnae gie hïm onie answer tae that ava.
Whan Jesus saa tha fowk thair aa makkin fer tha best saits ïn tha hoose, he toul thaim thïs parable:

Whaniver ye get an ïnvite tae a waddin, dïnnae be settin yersel doon at tha tap table, fer anither bodie mair impoartin ner yersel micht be cumin tae ït. 
LUK.14.9	Sae then tha yin that axt baith o yis tae tha waddin wud hae tae say tae ye, Wull ye gie thïs man yer sait?" Ye wudnae know whar tae pit yersel, wud ye? An ye’ll hae tae shïft tae tha bak o tha ruim!"

But whan ye get an ïnvite, gang an sït doon at tha bak, an whan tha yin that ïnvitit ye sees ye, he wull say, "Freen, whut ir ye daein awa bak thair? Cum on up here tae tha front!" Then aa tha ither fowk thair wull see that ye ir summodie!
Whaiver sets hissel up as summodie, tha Loard’ll brïng hïm doon. Whaiver taks tha hummel place, wull be gien tha place o honour."

Then Jesus turnt tae tha yin that haed gien hïm tha ïnvite an saed: "Whaniver ye gie a dennèr or a pairtie, dïnnae be caain yer freens, or yer brithers, yer femlie or yer weel-aff nighbers, acause the’ wull onlie pye ye bak bi ïnvitin ye ïn return.
But whaniver ye gie a bïg swaree, caa aa tha puir, tha lameters, tha halt an tha blin fowk.
The’ cannae pye ye bak, but God wull bliss ye an gie ye yer reward whan he raises tha just fowk frae tha deid."
Whan yin o thaim that wus sïttin at table wi Jesus heerd thïs, he saed tae hïm, "Blisst ïs tha yin that wull sït doon tae ait ïn tha Kïngdom o God."
Then Jesus saed tae hïm, "Yinst thair wus thïs man giein a bïg pairtie, an he axt a hale lock o fowk tae ït.
An whan tha time fer tha bïg pairtie cum roon, he sent hïs sarvin man oot wi a message fer tha yins that wus axt: 'Ye ir tae cum noo, fer iveriethin’s readie.'
But the’ stairtit yin an aa tae mak excuses. Tha furst yin saed, 'A hae jist bocht a bït o lan, an A hae tae gang an luk at ït. A beg ye tae let me aff.'
Anither yin saed, 'A hae bocht five yok o kye, an A hae tae gang an try thaim oot. A beg ye tae let me aff.'
An anither saed, 'Luk, A hae jist got merriet! A cannae cum.' "

Sae, saed Jesus, "tha sarvin man cum an gien an accoont o ït tae hïs maistèr. Then tha maistèr o tha hoose wus wile ang’rie, an toul hïs sarvin man, 'Gang oot quïck ïntae tha raas an tha entries, an brïng ïn tha puir, tha lameters, tha blin an tha halt fowk.'
Latèr on, tha sarvin man cum bak an saed, 'Maistèr, A hae daen as ye bïd me, yit thair’s still ruim fer mair.'

An tha maistèr toul hïs sarvin man, 'Gang oot ïntae tha róads an loanins; dïnnae tak Na fer an answer, mak thaim cum, fer A want ma hoose fïllt! An A’ll tell yis thïs', qo he, 'nane o thaim that wur ïnvitit at tha furst wull iver sup wi me!' "
Bïg croods wus follaein Jesus, an he turnt tae thaim an saed,

If onie man cums tae me, an pits hïs faither or hïs mither, hïs wife or hïs weans, hïs brithers or sïstèrs, aye, or even hïs ain sel afore me, he cannae be ma follaer. 
LUK.14.27	Whaiver daesnae tak up hïs ain cross, an cum eftèr me, cannae be a follaer o mine.
LUK.14.28	Jist say yin o yis haes a mine tae big a ture. Wud he no sït doon furst an coont tha coast, tae see ïf he haes eneuch tae feenish ït? 
LUK.14.29	Eftèr he haes püt ïn tha fïttins, ïf he fins he’s no able tae feenish ït - aa tha fowk roon aboot wull mak fun o hïm, wull the’ no? 
LUK.14.30	The’ wull say, 'Thïs man stairtit tae big, an wusnae able tae fïnish tha jab!'
LUK.14.31	Or agane, ïf a kïng wus gaun tae war wi anither kïng, wud he no sït doon furst an jalouse ïf he wud be able, wi ten thoosan sodgers, tae bate hïm that’s cumin agin hïm wi twuntie thoosan? 
LUK.14.32	If he fins he’s no able, then while hïs enemie ïs a lang róad aff, he’ll senn a go-between tae hïm, an ax fer terms o peace. 
LUK.14.33	Jist ïn tha same wye, whaiver o yis wull no gie up aa ye hae, cannae be ma follaer.
LUK.14.34	Saut ïs guid; but ïf ït loasses ïts taste, hoo dae ye mak ït saltie agane? 
LUK.14.35	It ïs nether fït fer tha lan ner tha midden; fowk jist clod ït oot. Let hïm that haes ears ïn hïs heid tak tent!
Noo tha tex men an tha wrangdaers gethert roon tae gie hïm thair ear.
An tha Pharisees an tha maistèrs o tha Laa kep grummlin an the’ saed, "Thïs man ïs weel ïn wi wrangdaers an e’en gaes ïn fer a bite tae ait wi thaim."
Sae Jesus toul thaim thïs parable an saed,

Say a man amang yis haed a hunnèr sheep; ïf he loast yin o thaim, wud he no lea tha ninetie-nine oot on tha muirs, an gang eftèr tha yin that wus loast tae he fins ït? 
LUK.15.5	An whan he haes fun ït, he’s gye gled an he pits ït on hïs shoodèr, an he heids awa hame wi ït. 
LUK.15.6	An whan he gets hame, he caas thegither hïs freens an nighbers an he says tae thaim, 'Cum on an see. Ir yis no hairt gled wi me A hae fun ma loast sheep?' 
LUK.15.7	A tell yis, jist ïn tha same wye, thair wull be mair joy ïn heiven ower yin wrangdaer that repents o hïs wrangdaein, mair ner ower ninetie-nine that thïnks the’ dïnnae need tae repent.

Or agane, ïf a wumman haed ten siller coins an she loast yin o thaim, wud she no tak a bricht licht, redd up tha hoose, an luk ïn iverie neuk an crannie tae she fins ït? 
LUK.15.9	An whaniver she’s fun ït, she caas thegither hir freens an nighbers an she says, 'Cum on an see. Ir yis no hairt gled wi me A hae fun ma loast coin?' 
LUK.15.10	A tell yis, jist ïn tha same wye, thair’s joy amang tha angels o God ower yin wrangdaer that turns frae hïs wrangdaein.
Jesus went on tae say, "Thair wus thïs man wi twa sinns.
Tha young’r yin saed tae hïs faither, 'Can A hae noo whut ye wur fer leain me ïn yer wull?' Sae tha faither divïd whut he haed atween tha twa o thaim.
A wheen o days latèr, tha young’r yin gethert up aa hïs belangins an he went aff tae a faur aff kintrie. He spent aa roon hïm ïn wile leevin.
Aboot tha time hïs money run oot, thair wus a wile baad famine ower tha hale lan, an he wus starvin wi hung’r.
Sae he hired hissel oot tae a local fairmer that sent hïm oot tae hïs fiels tae feed pïgs.
Tha young fella wus that hung’rie got, he wus near aitin tha husks he wus feedin tae tha pïgs. An naebodie gien hïm ocht ava.
Whan he cum tae hïs senses he thocht tae hissel, 'Ma faither’s sarvints bak hame haes eneuch tae ait an tae spare, an here A am, deein wi hung’r!
A’ll git up an gae hame tae ma faither an A’ll say: A hae sïnned agin heiven an agin yersel,
an A’m nae lang’r fït tae be caad yer sinn. Wud ye no tak me on as yin o yer hired men?'
Sae he ris up an he went bak hame tae hïs faither.
But whan he wus yit a lang róads aff, hïs faither saa hïm cumin, an hïs hairt went oot tae hïm, an he run an throwed hïs airms roon hïm an he kïsst hïm.
Tha sinn saed tae hïm, 'A hae sïnned agin heiven an agin yersel, an A’m nae mair fït tae be caad yer sinn.'
But tha faither saed tae hïs sarvints, 'Rin, brïng oot tha guid robe an pit ït on hïm, pit a rïng on hïs fïng’r an shune on hïs feet.
An brïng forrit tha calf we wur fattenin up, an kïll ït, fer we’r gaun tae hae a bïg pairtie.
Fer thïs sinn o mine wus deid, an noo he’s bak tae life agane; he wus loast, but noo he’s fun.' Sae tha pairtie begun.
Noo while aa thïs wus gaun on, tha ouler sinn wus oot warkin ïn tha fiels, an whan he cum near tha hoose he heerd aa tha music an dauncin.
Sae he caad yin o tha sarvints an he axt hïm whut wus gaun on.
Tha sarvint toul hïm, 'Yer brither haes cum hame, an yer faither haes kïllt tha wee calf we wur fattenin, fer he’s gled tae hae hïs sinn hame safe an soon.'
Tha ouler brither wus ang’rie an he wudnae gae ïntae tha hoose; sae hïs faither cum oot an tried tae taak hïm roon.
But he saed tae hïs faither, 'Luk, A hae wrocht haird fer ye aa these yeirs, an no yinst hae A no daen yer bïddin. Aa thïs time ye niver even gien me a wee góat tae hae a swaree wi ma freens!
Yit whan thïs waster o a sinn o yers cums hame, eftèr skailin yer money aa roon hïm on baad weemen an tha laik, ye gae an kïll tha best calf aboot tha place fer hïm!'
An tha faither saed, 'Ma sinn, ye ir ay wi me, an aa that A hae ïs yours.
It’s onlie but richt we shud be joyfu an gled, fer thïs brither o yers wus deid, an noo he’s bak tae life. He wus loast, but noo he’s fun.' "
An Jesus went on tae say tae hïs follaers: "Yinst thair wus a weel-aff man that haed a bodie lukkin eftèr hïs affairs, an summodie toul hïm that thïs owerseer wus squannèrin iveriethin.
Sae tha weel-aff man confrontit hïm aboot thïs an he saed, 'Whut’s thïs A hear aboot ye? Gie an accoont o whut ye hae daen, fer A’ll no hae ye aboot tha place onie mair.'
Then tha owerseer saed tae hissel: 'Whut’ll A dae whan A hae nae steadie wark? A’m no fït tae dïg an A wud be affrontit tae beg.
A know whut A’ll dae, sae that fowk dïnnae gie me tha coul shoodèr whaniver A loass ma jab!'
Yin bi yin he caad ïn tha fowk that wur ïn debt tae hïs boss, an he axt tha furst yin: 'Hoo much dae ye owe tha maistèr?'
'A hunnèr barrels o oyle,' saed he. Sae tha foreman toul hïm: 'Tak yer bïll, sït doon thair quïck an pit doon fïftie!'
An tae anither he saed, 'An whut dae ye owe?' 'A hunnèr baags o wheat,' saed he. Sae tha owerseer saed tae hïm: 'Luk here, tak yer bïll an pit doon echtie baags!'

Tha maistèr o tha crookit owerseer haed tae gie credit tae hïm fer tha wye he haed o gettin ïn wi fowk. Fer tha fowk o thïs warl ir whiles mair lang-heidit ïn thair dailins than tha yins that hae saen tha licht.
An A’m tellin ye, yis shud uise yer warlie siller tae mak freens ïn tha warl; an sae, whan money’s nae mair use tae ye, yis wull be gien a walcum ïntae yer iverlastin hame.
If yis ir faithfu ïn wee thïngs then yis wull be faithfu ïn bïgger yins. In tha same wye, hïm that’s no strecht ïn wee thïngs wull no be strecht ïn bïg thïngs.
If yis cannae be trustit wi warlie walth, wha wull trust yis wi tha true riches o heiven?
If ye cannae be trustit wi ither fowk’s money, wha wull gie ye money o yer ain tae luk eftèr?
A slave cannae sarve twa maistèrs; fer ether he’ll hait tha yin an love tha ither, or he’ll stïck bye tha yin an thïnk naethin o tha ither. Ye cannae sarve baith God an Gowld."
An tha Pharisees that likt thair money heerd aa thïs, an the’ stairtit tae gaeg hïm.

But he saed tae thaim: "Yous ir tha yins that try tae prove yersels richt ïn tha sicht o fowk, but God knows whut’s ïn yer hairts, fer tha thïngs that’s tarrible weel thocht o bi men wud be a scunnèr tae God.
Afore Jhone, fowk leeved bi tha Laa o Moses an tha proaphits; but noo tha Kïngdom o God ïs praicht, an iveriebodie’s püshin thair wye ïn.
But that daesnae main that tha Laa daesnae stan, fer ït daes, ïn iverie wee point. It’s as strang an steadie as heiven an irth thegither.
Whaiver pits awa hïs wife an gets merriet agane ïs commïttin adultèrie; an whaiver merries hir that’s divorced commïts adultèrie as weel."
An Jesus went on tae say: "Yin time thair wus thïs weel-aff man that dresst up ïn fancie claes, an leeved iverie day ïn tha lap o luxurie.
An then thair wus thïs puir beggar, covert wi sairs, caad Lazarus, that lay at hïs gate.
Lazarus wus hopin that tha rich man wud gie hïm tha leains frae hïs table. Whiles, tha doags wud cum an lïck hïs sairs.
In tha enn tha beggar deed an tha angels cairriet hïm awa tae be wi Abraham. Tha rich man deed forbye an wus buriet.
An whan he wus sufferin sair ïn hell he cud see Abraham an Lazarus thegither a lang wyes aff.
An he cryed oot tae thaim an saed, 'Faither Abraham, tak peetie on me an senn Lazarus tae dook tha enn o hïs fïng’r ïn tha wattèr tae cool ma tung doon, fer A’m tormentit wi tha bleeze o thïs fire!'
But Abraham saed, 'Ma sinn, dae ye mine tha time whan ye wur leevin on irth? You haed iveriethin an Lazarus haed naethin, an noo he’s at peace an ye ir tormentit.
An apairt frae aa that, thair’s a bïg deep sheuch atween iz baith, sae that we can hae nae dailins wi yin anither.'
Then tha rich man saed, 'Faither Abraham, wud ye no senn Lazarus tae ma faither’s hoose tae warn ma five brithers, sae that the’ dïnnae enn up here ïn torment laik masel?'
But Abraham saed bak tae hïm, 'The’ hae bin aareadie warnt bi Moses an tha proaphits - let thaim tak heed tae that warnin!'
An tha rich man saed, 'Na, faither Abraham, but ïf summodie frae tha deid appeart tae thaim, the’ wud turn awa frae thair sïns an bak tae God.'
But Abraham saed, 'If the’ dïnnae heed whut Moses an tha proaphits toul thaim, then ït’ll no mak onie dïffernce ïf summodie cum bak tae thaim frae tha deid.' "
Yin day Jesus saed tae hïs follaers, "Thair’ll ay be temptation tae dae wrang, but dear halp tha yin that daes tha tempin!
It wud be faur bettèr fer hïm ïf a mïllstane wus hung roon hïs neck an he wus drapt ïntae tha sea, rether ner hïm leadin yin o these puir wee craiters asthray.
Lïsten here, ïf summodie daes ocht agin ye, tell hïm he shudnae hae daen ït, an ïf he says he’s sorrie, then forgie hïm.
An ïf he keeps on daein ye wrang seiven times a day an ïs sorrie iverie time, then ye maun still forgie hïm."
An tha possels saed tae tha Loard, "Show iz hoo we can hae mair faith."
An tha Loard saed, "If yis haed faith as smaa as a mustèrt seed even, yis cud say tae thïs mulberry tree: 'Cum oot bi tha ruit an plant yersel ïn tha sea', an richt awa ït’d dae whut ït’s toul.

Whaniver yer sarvin man cums ïn frae tha pluein an mindin tha beese, ye wudnae say tae hïm, 'Sït yersel doon quïck an hae a bite tae ait.' Rether ye wud tell hïm tae clain hissel up an sarve you furst, an then tak hïs ain eftèr.
A doot ye wudnae say, 'Thenks', tae yer ain man fer daein whut he’s pyed tae dae!
In tha same wye, whan ye dae ma bïddin, ye shud say: 'We’r naethin oot o tha ordinarie! Fer we hae daen nae mair ner we haed tae.' "
An sae Jesus went on tae Jerusalem, follaein tha mairch atween Samaria an Galilee.
As he went ïntae yin o tha vïllages, he saa ten men that wur lepers stannin a wyes aff, an the’ caad oot tae hïm: "Jesus, Maistèr, tak peetie on iz!"
An whaniver he saa thaim, he saed, "Awa tae tha preeshts an let thaim luk at ye." An lo an behol, as the’ went thair wye, the’ wur healt!
An yin o thaim, whan he saen he wus cured, turnt bak an cryed oot at tha tap o hïs voice, "Praise God!" Then he faad doon at Jesus’ feet an gien thenks. An tha man wus a Samaritan, sae he wus.
Dïd A no cure ten men? axt Jesus. "Whar’s tha ither nine? Hae nane o thaim cum bak tae gie thenks tae God apairt frae thïs foreigner?"
Jesus saed tae tha man, "Rise up an gang yer wye, yer faith haes made ye weel."
Yin time whaniver tha Pharisees axt Jesus whan God’s Kïngdom wud cum, he toul thaim, "Yis cannae say, 'Here ït’s!' or 'Thair ït’s!' Tha Kïngdom o God ïs aareadie here amang yis
An he saed tae hïs follaers, "Tha day wull cum whan yis’ll want tae see tha Sinn o Man. Yis’ll luk fer me an A’ll no be here.
Fowk micht say, 'He’s here or he’s thair', but tak nae notysh, an dïnnae rin eftèr thaim.
Fer jist as tha lichtnin fleshes ower tha lïft, that’s whut laik ït’ll be, tha day tha Sinn o Man cums bak.
But afore that, He’ll hae tae suffer sair, an tha fowk roon hïm noo wull turn agin hïm.
Whaniver tha Sinn o Man cums bak, ït'll be jist laik ït wus ïn Noah's day.
Fer fowk wus aitin an drïnkin an gettin merriet, richt up tae tha verie day Noah went ïntae tha airk, then tha wattèr floodit an aa wur droont.
It wull be tha same as ït wus ïn tha time o Lot; the’ et an drank an cairriet on wi thair bïzness o buyin, sellin, fairmin an biggin.
But tha verie day that Lot went oot o Sodom, fire an brimstane cum doon frae heiven an the’ wur aa kïllt.
Tha same wull happen tha day yis see tha Sinn o Man cum bak.
On that day, naebodie shud lea hïs ruiftap
Mine whut happent tae Lot’s guidwife!
Whaiver houls on tae hïs life wull loass ït, an whaiver gies up hïs life wull ay hae ït.
A’m tellin yis, ïn that nicht, twa fowk wull be ïn tha yin bed, yin wull be tuk an tha ither left behin;
Twa weemen wull be grindin mail thegither, yin wull be tuk an tha ither left behin; [
Twa men wull be ïn tha fiel, tha yin wull be tuk an tha ither left behin."]

An hïs follaers axt hïm, "Whar wull thïs tak place?" An Jesus toul thaim, "Whar ye see a crood o vultèrs, ye know thair’s a deid bodie aboot. Aye, sae whaniver ye see tha signs A’m taakin aboot, then ye’ll know weel eneuch!"
Jesus toul hïs follaers thïs parable, that meent that the’ shud ay pray an no gie up.
An ït went laik thïs. "Thair wus thïs judge ïn a bïg toon, that haed nae fear o ether God ner man, an haed nae thocht fer oniebodie.
In that same toon thair wus thïs weeda wumman, that kep on cumin tae tha judge, sayin, 'Wud ye mak shair A get a fair dail ïn tha coort frae tha yin wha’s agin me?'

At tha stairt tha judge niver bothert: fer a lang time he dïd naethin. But then he saed tae hissel: 'Tha mair A dïnnae fear God or care aboot fowk, still wi aa, A wull halp oot thïs weeda wumman, fer she’s giein me that much bother. A’m scunnèrt wi hir ay rinnin tae me!' "
Tha Loard went on: "Yis unnèrstan whut tha baad judge ïs sayin.
Dae yis no thïnk God wull tak tha pairt o hïs ain fowk that cry oot tae hïm day an nicht? He’ll no keep pittin thaim aff, sae he’ll no.
A’m tellin yis, He’ll no be lang ïn seein justice daen. But whaniver tha Sinn o Man cums bak, A wunnèr wull he fin oniebodie wi faith on tha irth?"
An he toul anither parable tae tha yins that wus fu o thairsels, an thocht the’ wur aa richt, an lukt doon on ithers.

Thair wus twa men went up tae tha Hoose o God fer tae pray. Yin wus a Pharisee an tha ither wus a tex man. 
LUK.18.11+LUK.18.12	Tha Pharisee ris tae hïs feet, an prayed tae hissel: 'O God, A thank ye that A’m no laik ither fowk, ner fer that mettèr laik thon tex boy ower thonner! A dïnnae chait fowk, A dae naethin wrang, an A keep tae me ain wife. A fast twice ïn tha week, an A gie a tenth o aa A hae.' 
LUK.18.13	But tha tex man stud awa bak, an wudnae as much as lïft hïs een tae heiven, but he bate hïs breesht ïn sorra, an saed, 'O God, hae mercie on me, fer A’m naethin but a sïnner!' 
LUK.18.14	A tell ye, thïs tex man, an no tha Pharisee, went doon tae hïs hoose ïn guid stannin wi God. Fer tha yin that thïnks a lock o hissel wull be brocht doon, but tha yin that’s hummel wull be lïftit up.
An as weel, the’ brocht wee weans tae Jesus, sae that he cud pit hïs hans on thaim tae bliss thaim. But whaniver tha follaers saen thïs, the’ chackt tha fowk.
But Jesus toul thaim tae cum on aheid, an saed, "Alloo tha weans tae cum tae me, dïnnae stap thaim, fer tha Kïngdom o God belangs tae tha laik o these.
A’m tellin ye, whaiver daesnae tak tha Kïngdom o God ïntae hïs hairt laik a wean daes, wull no get ïn ava."
Yinst an impoartin bodie axt hïm, "Guid Maistèr, whut maun A dae tae be shair A get tae heiven an leeve fer iver?"
An Jesus saed bak tae hïm, "Why ir ye caain me guid? Thair’s naebodie guid, apairt frae God.
Ye weel ken tha commauns: 'Dïnnae commït adultèrie'; 'dïnnae murdèr'; 'dïnnae tak whut’s no yer ain'; 'dïnnae tell lees aboot ither fowk'; an 'gie respeck tae yer faither an yer mither.' "
An tha bodie saed bak tae hïm, "A hae daen aa these thïngs since A wus onie age."

Whan Jesus heerd thïs, he saed tae tha man, "Thair’s jist yin thïng ye still hae tae dae. Sell aa ye hae an gie tae thaim that haesnae much, an ye’ll hae walth ïn heiven. An then cum bak an follae me!"
Noo whaniver tha man heerd thïs he wus doon ïn tha mooth, fer he haed a wile lock o money.
An whaniver Jesus saa tha wye tha man tuk ït, he saed, "Hoo verie haird ït ïs fer thaim that haes money tae git ïntae tha Kïngdom o God!
Fer ït wud be aisier fer a kemel tae gae throu tha ee o a needle, ner fer a monied man tae git ïntae tha Kïngdom o God."
An tha yins that heerd ït axt, "Wha ïn aa tha warl can be saved then?"
An Jesus saed, "Thaim thïngs men cannae dae, God’s mair ner fït tae dae!"
Wi that, Petèr saed, "Mine, we hae left iveriethin behin an follaed ye!"

An Jesus saed tae thaim, "A’m tellin yis, oniebodie that haes left hïs hoose, hïs faither an mither, brithers, wife or weans fer tha sake o tha Kïngdom o God wull dae weel an hae plentie ïn thïs warl; an ïn tha warl tae cum he wull hae iverlastin life."
Then he tuk tha Twal tae tha side an he saed tae thaim: "See here, we’r gaun up tae Jerusalem, an aa that’s bin writ doon bi tha proaphits aboot tha Sinn o Man wull tak place thair.
Fer he’ll be hannit ower tae tha Gentiles fer thaim tae mak fun o hïm, trait hïm ïll an spït on hïm.
An the’ wull gie hïm a whuppin an kïll hïm, but on tha thurd day he wull rise tae life agane."
But the’ dïdnae unnèrstan onie o tha thïngs he saed, fer tha mainin wus hïd frae thaim, an the’ jist cudnae tak ït ïn.
Noo whan Jesus wus cumin up tae Jericho, on tha ootskirts, a blin man wus sïttin beggin on tha bunker o tha róad.
Whan he heerd tha thrang gaun bye, he axt whut ït wus aa aboot,
an the’ toul hïm, "Jesus o Nazareth ïs cumin."
Tha blin man cryed oot, "Jesus, Sinn o Davit, tak peetie on me!"
An tha yins that went afore Jesus scoult tha beggar an toul hïm tae be quait, but he guldèrt aa tha mair, "Sinn o Davit, tak peetie on me!"
An Jesus stapt an saed, "Brïng tha blin man tae me!" An whan the’ dïd, Jesus axt hïm:
Whut dae ye want me tae dae fer ye? An he saed, "Loard, A want tae be able tae see agane."
An Jesus saed bak tae hïm, "Hae yer sicht! Yer faith haes made ye hale."
Richt awa he cud see agane, an he follaed Jesus, giein glorie tae God. An whan aa tha ither fowk saa thïs, the’ gien praise tae God as weel.
An Jesus cum tae tha toon o Jericho, an wus trevelin throu ït.
Noo, thair wus thïs man caad Zacchaeus, that wus a heid tex man, an he wus quare an weel-aff.
An he wus wantin tae see fer hissel whut Jesus wus laik, but he wus a wee man, an he cudnae get near Jesus fer tha crood.
Sae he run awa on aheid, an shïnned up a sycomore fïg tree alang tha wye, tae hae a guid luk at Jesus whan he wus gaun bye.
An whan Jesus cum tae tha tree, he lukt up an saed til hïm: "Zacchaeus, git doon or that richt noo! Fer A’m gaun tae yer hoose tha day!
Sae Zacchaeus lep doon oot o tha tree, an tuk hïm hame an gien hïm a wile guid walcum.
Aa tha fowk saen thïs, an stairtit tae pass remarks, sayin, "He’s stappin ower wi a wrangdaer!"
Oniehoo, Zacchaeus stud up an toul Jesus: "A tell ye whut, Loard. A’ll gie tha half o whut A hae tae thaim as haes need o ït. An ïf A hae got oniethin bi chaitin, A’ll pye ït bak fower times ower."
An Jesus saed, "Salvation haes cum tae thïs hoose tha day, fer thïs man ïs a sinn o Abraham as weel!
A masel, tha Sinn o Man, hae cum tae luk fer thaim at’s loast, an tae save thaim."
An tha hale crood tuk tent o whut Jesus wus sayin. An as Jerusalem wus nearhan, he stairtit tae tell thaim a parable, fer fowk thocht that tha Kïngdom o God wus gaun tae cum aboot at yinst.
He toul thaim thïs: "A weel boarn man went awa tae a faur aff lan. He wus tae hae hissel crooned kïng, an then he wus tae cum bak agane.
Afore he went but, he caad ten o hïs sarvin men, an gien each o thaim yin gowld coin
But he wusnae weel thocht o amang hïs ain fowk, an sae the’ sent oot wurd eftèr he went awa, sayin, 'We dïnnae want thïs man tae rule ower iz.'
But he got tae be kïng aa tha same, an he cum bak hame. Then he oardèrt tha sarvin men tae gie an accoont o hoo the’ haed daen wi tha catter he haed gien thaim.
Tha furst yin toul hïm: 'Loard, yer coin haes made ten mair.'
'Weel daen!' saed tha kïng. 'Ye ir a guid sarvint. Ye hae showed A can trust ye ïn wee thïngs. A’ll gie ye ten cïties tae rin!'
An tha saicont yin cum an saed, 'Loard, yer coin haes made five coins.'
An tha kïng saed, 'A’ll gie ye five cïties tae rin.'
Wi that, anither yin cum up an saed, 'Luk, Loard, here’s yer coin. A hae kep ït lapt up ïn a cloot.
A wus feart o ye, fer ye ir a haird man tae dail wi. Ye tak whut daesnae belang tae ye, an ye hairvest whut ye hinnae plantit.'

Tha kïng cum bak wi: 'Ye uisless guid-for-naethin! Frae yer ain mooth ye hae condemned yersel. Sae ye thocht A wus a haird man, dïd ye, takkin whut dïdnae belang tae me, an hairvestin whut A haednae plantit?
Weel, ye cud hae püt ma siller ïntae tha bank; hoo cum ye dïdnae? Then whaniver A cum bak, ït cudda made me a wee bït o ïntrèst!'
Wi that, tha kïng toul thaim that wur stannin roon aboot: 'Tak hïs coin frae hïm, an gie ït tae hïm that haes tha ten.'
But the’ saed tae hïm: 'Loard, shair he haes ten coin!'
Saed tha kïng: 'A’ll tell ye thïs, iverie yin that haes wull be gien mair; an whaiver haes lïttle ir naethin, even whut he haes wull be taen awa frae hïm!
But as fer thaim as wur agin me an wudnae hae me fer kïng, brïng thaim here tae me, an kïll thaim forenent me!' "
Eftèr tellin thaim aa thïs, Jesus went on aheid alang tha róad up tae Jerusalem.
An whan he wus cum near til Bethphage an Bethanie, nixt tha hïll caad tha Moont o Olives, he sent on twa o hïs follaers,
sayin tae thaim: "Awa ïntae thon clachan forenent iz. Whan yis git thair, ye’ll fin a cowlt tyed up, that naebodie haes iver sut on. Lowse ïts raip, an brïng ït til me.
If onie yin axes yis hoo cum yis ir lowsin tha cowlt, jist tell thaim: 'Tha Loard haes need o ït!' "
Noo tha twa that went fun ït jist as the’ haed bin toul.
An as the’ wur lowsin tha cowlt, tha yins ït belanged tae axt thaim: "Whut ir ye daein, lowsin that cowlt?"
Saed tha twa: "Tha Loard haes want o ït!"
An the’ brocht ït tae Jesus. An pittin thair claes on tha cowlt’s bak, the’ tuk houl o ït tae Jesus got on.
Wi that, as Jesus made hïs wye alang, tha fowk spread thair claes doon afore hïm on tha pad.
An whaniver he wus cumin nearhan tha pad doon frae tha Moont o Olives, hïs follaers stairtit shoutin oot wi joy tha hale lock o thaim, praisin God fer aa tha miracles the’ haed saen, an cryin oot:
Blisst ïs tha Kïng that cums ïn tha name o tha Loard. Peace ïn heiven abain, an glorie ïn tha heichest!
An some o tha Pharisees amang tha thrang saed tae Jesus, "Maistèr, scoul yer follaers an tell thaim tae quït ït!"
But he cum bak wi thïs: "A’m tellin yis, ïf they ir quait, e’en tha stanes thairsels wull cry oot!"
Jesus wus cumin near tae Jerusalem noo, an whan he saa tha cïtie, he begun tae greet, an he saed,

Och, ïf ye onlie haed o knowed whut wud brïng ye peace tha day! But na, ye dïdnae, an noo ït’s hïd frae yer een. 
LUK.19.43	Fer tha time wull cum whan thaim that’s agin ye wull big dykes aa roon ye, an fence ye ïn frae aa sides. 
LUK.19.44	Ye’ll be flettent ïntae tha grun, an aa yer fowk alang wi ye. The’ll no lea yin stane on anither, fer ye dïdnae ken tha day that God cum tae ye.
An yinst he got tae Jerusalem, whut Jesus daen wus thïs: he went strecht ïntae tha Hoose o God, an he begun reddin oot tha dailers frae tha coortyaird.
It ïs writ doon, he saed tae thaim, "that 'ma hoose wull be a hoose o prayer.' But yous hae turnt ït ïntae a den o robbers!"
An eftèr that, iverie day, Jesus stairtit lairnin tha fowk ïn tha Hoose o God. An tha heid preeshts, tha maistèrs o tha Laa, an tha heidyins amang tha fowk wus oot tae get rïd o hïm,
but the’ cud dae naethin aboot ït, fer he wusnae iver on hïs lane; an aa tha fowk hung on hïs iverie wurd.
On yin o thaim days, as Jesus wus lairnin tha fowk that wur ïn tha Hoose o God, an praichin tha Guid News, tha heid preeshts, tha maistèrs o tha Laa, an tha eldèrs amang tha fowk cum up tae hïm
an saed, "Tell iz thïs, bi whut thortie ir ye daein these thïngs, an wha gien ye ït?"
An he cum bak wi, "A hae a question tae ax you as weel. Jist tell me thïs:
Jhone’s baptisin, wus ït frae heiven, or wus ït jist a notion o man?"
An the’ taakt aboot ït tae yin anither, an saed, "If we gie tha answer, 'Frae heiven', he wull say, 'Hoo cum yis dïdnae believe hïm then?'
But ïf we say, 'Frae men', aa tha fowk wull clod iz wi stanes, fer the’ hae nae doot that Jhone wus a proaphit!"
Sae the’ toul hïm that the’ cudnae tell whar Jhone’s baptisin haed cum frae.
An Jesus saed tae thaim: "Then A’ll no be tellin yis ether bi whut thortie A dae these thïngs!"
He turnt tae tha fowk an toul thaim thïs parable:

Thair wus thïs man plantit a vineyaird an he set ït tae a wheen o tenant-fairmers tae rin, afore gaun awa fer a lang time tae anither kintrie. 
LUK.20.10	An whaniver hairvest time cum roon, he sent a sarvin man tae tha fairmers, tae get a taste o tha fruit frae thaim, but the’ bate up tha sarvin man an chaist hïm awa empie-hannit. 
LUK.20.11	Sae he sent anither sarvin man, but the’ creesht hïm as weel, wur wile baad til hïm, an sent hïm awa wi naethin. 
LUK.20.12	Agane he sent anither yin oot, an the’ hurt hïm an flung hïm oot tae. 
LUK.20.13	Then tha laird o tha vineyaird saed, 'Whut wull A dae? A know, A’ll senn ma ain sinn that A love. The' ir shair tae hae regaird fer hïm!' 
LUK.20.14	But whaniver tha tenant-fairmers saen tha sinn, the’ taakt ït ower an saed, 'Thïs ïs tha boy that wull git aa thïs here whan hïs da dees. If we kïll hïm, aa thïs cud be oors!' 
LUK.20.15	Sae the’ püt hïm oot o tha vineyaird, an kïllt hïm.
An Jesus axt: "Whut dae yis thïnk tha laird wull dae on thaim noo?
A’ll tell yis. He wull cum an desthroy thaim fairmers an set tha vineyaird tae ithers."
Whan tha fowk lïstenin tae Jesus heerd thïs, the’ saed, "Thïs shud niver cum aboot!"
But Jesus lukt at thaim strecht ïn tha ee an axt: "Whut then ïs tha mainin o thïs Scrïpture:
'Tha verie stane tha masons turnt doon
Is noo tha corner stane'?
Aa tha yins that faa ower thon stane wull be smesht tae bïts; an whaiver ït faas on wull be grun tae poodèr."
Tha maistèrs o tha Laa an tha heid preeshts lukt fer a wye tae tak houl o hïm thair an then, fer the’ kent he haed spauk agin thaim ïn thïs parable. But the’ wur feart o whut tha fowk wud dae.

Keepin a quare clase ee on hïm, the’ sent yins that lut on the’ wur honest, fer tae spie on hïm. The’ wur hopin tae ketch hïm oot ïn sumthin he saed, fer the’ wantit tae be able tae han hïm ower tae tha pooer o tha Roman Guviner.

These yins that wur spiein on Jesus axt hïm, sayin: "Maistèr, ye taak an taich whut ïs richt. Ye dïnnae mak o yin mair ner tha ither, but ye taich God’s wye an tha truith. Tell iz, ïs ït richt fer iz tae pye tex tae Caesar or no?"
But Jesus saa throu thaim an he saed, "[Dïnnae try me oot.] Let me see a denarius
It’s Caesar’s, the’ saed. "Then gie Caesar whut belangs tae Caesar," saed he, "an gie God whut belangs tae God."
That settelt thaim. The’ wurnae able tae ketch hïm oot afore tha fowk fer whut he haed saed. An the’ haed tae be quait, fer hïs answer flebbergestit thaim.
An sartin Sadducees - thaim that say thair ïsnae onie risin frae tha deid - cum tae pit a question tae Jesus:
Maistèr, the’ saed, "Moses writ doon fer iz, that ïf a man’s brither dees an leas a guidwife wi nae weans, then he maun merrie tha weeda an hae childèr fer hïs deid brither.
Noo, whut ïf thair wus seiven brithers. Tha oulest gets merriet, an he dees wi’oot haein onie weans.
Sae tha saicont brither, he merries tha weeda, an he dees as weel. Still nae weans.
An tha thurd merries hir, an ïn tha same wye aa seiven brithers merries hir an dees, leain nae femlie ava.
An ïn tha enn tha wumman, she deed as weel.
Noo at tha risin frae tha deid, whase guidwife wull she be, fer she wus merriet on tha hale seiven o thaim?"
Jesus cum bak wi thïs: "Men an weemen o thïs warl get merriet.
But thaim that ir coontit fït tae be pairt o tha risin frae tha deid an tha nixt warl, thair wull be nae mair merryin fer thaim.
The’ll be laik tha angels an the’ cannae dee; the’ ir childèr o God an childèr o tha risin frae tha deid.

But even Moses - whaniver he writ aboot tha burnin büsh - showed that tha deid rises agane, fer he caas tha Loard 'tha God o Abraham, an tha God o Isaac, an tha God o Jacob', lang eftèr the’ wur aa deid!
He’s no tha God o tha deid, he’s tha God o tha leevin, fer iveriebodie’s leevin ïn God’s een."
An some o tha maistèrs o tha Laa saed, "Weel spauk, Maistèr!"
But naebodie ava wud dar ax hïm onie mair questions.
Then Jesus axt thaim, "Hoo can the’ mak oot that tha Messiah
Fer Davit hissel says ïn tha buik o Psalms: 'Tha Loard saed tae ma Loard: Sït doon at ma richt han,
tae A mak o yer enemies a stool fer unnèr yer fit.'
Sae Davit caas tha Messiah ' ma Loard'. Hoo can he be hïs sinn then?"
Whaniver aa tha fowk wus lïstenin, Jesus saed tae hïs follaers:

Dïnnae tak heed o tha maistèrs o tha Laa, fer the’ ir fand o paradin aboot ïn fancie robes, an the’ love fowk tae touch thair keps tae thaim ïn tha mairket places. The’ laik tae hae tha best saits ïn tha Meetin Hooses, an tae be at tha tap table at faists. 
LUK.20.47	The’ halp thairsels bi daein weeda weemen oot o aa the’ hae. An the’ mak lang screeds o prayers jist fer show. But yis can be shair ït wull be waur wi thaim at tha Day o Reckonin.
Jesus lukt up an saa tha weel-aff fowk pittin thair offerins ïntae tha kïst ïn tha Hoose o God.
Then he saen thïs puir weeda wumman drappin ïn twa pennies.
A’m tellin yis tha truith, qo he, "Thïs puir weeda haes gien mair ner onie o tha rest o thaim that gien offerins.
Aa these yins hae onlie gien a pïttance oot o thair pruch, but thïs weeda, puir an aa as she ïs, haes gien aa she haed tae leeve on."
Some o thaimins that wur wi hïm wur taakin amang thairsels aboot tha wye tha Hoose o God wus aa daen up, wi ïts bricht bonnie stanes, an coastlie ornyments gien ïn bi fowk.
But Jesus saed, "Tha day wull cum whan aa these stanes wull be tummelt doon, an no yin stane wull be left abain tha ither."
An the’ axt hïm, "Maistèr, whan’s aa thïs fer happenin then? An wull we hae onie sign o ït cumin?"
Jesus cum bak wi thïs: "Tak heed an dïnnae let oniebodie lead yis aglee, fer monies a yin wull cum ïn ma name sayin, 'A be tha Christ', or 'Tha time ïs cum.' Dïnnae pye thaim onie heed.
Whan yis hear tell o wars an fechtin, dïnnae be feart, fer sitch thïngs maun cum aboot furst, but tha enn ïs no near jist yit."
Then he saed tae thaim, "Nations wull mak war on ither nations, an kïngdoms wull rise up agin ither kïngdoms.
Thair wull be michtie irthquakes, dirths an plagues ïn dïffernt pairts, an fleysum sichts, an pooerfu signs frae heiven.

Hooaniver, afore aa thïs cums aboot, the’ll be takkin houl o yis, persecutin yis an turnin yis ïn at tha Meetin Hooses. The’ll clod yis ïntae jail an dreg yis up afore kïngs an goveners, jist fer bein ma follaers.
Thïs’ll be yer chaunce tae wutness tae yin an aa.
Sae pit yer mine tae ït then, an dïnnae fash yersels aforehan aboot whut kine o answer yis ir gaun tae gie.
Fer A wull pit tha richt wurds ïn yer mooth, an gie yis tha wut tae uise thaim, sae nane o yer enemies wull be able tae stan up tae yis, or say a wurd agin yis.
Yis’ll even be hannit ower bi thaim that ïs closest tae yis, yer mither an faither, yer brithers, yer freens an nighbers. An some o yis wull be kïllt.
An yis’ll be haitit bi aa fowk on accoont o me.
But no e’en yin hair o yer heid wull cum tae onie hairm.
Dïnnae gie up, thole aa that cums at ye, an yis’ll fin rael life.
Noo whan yis see tha airmies gethert aa roon Jerusalem, then yis wull ken that tha time fer ït tae be tummelt doon ïs nearhan.
Then thaim at’s ïn Judea maun tak tae tha hïlls, an thaim at’s ïn Jerusalem maun flee oot o ït, an thaim at’s ootside tha cïtie shudnae try tae get ïn.
Fer that’ll be tha day o God’s punishment, an whut wus foretoul bi tha proaphits maun cum aboot.
In thaim days ït’ll be tarrible fer weemen that’s expectin, an fer mithers wi weans at tha breesht. Thair’ll be a wile baad time o sufferin aa ower tha lan, an God’s ang’r wull be agin thïs fowk.

Some o thaim wull be kïllt bi tha sword; ithers’ll be tuk awa an skailt amang aa tha nations o tha warl. An Jerusalem wull be thrampt doon bi haithen feet, tae tha time o tha Gentiles cums tae an enn.

Thair’ll be quare signs ïn tha sin an tha muin an tha starns. An doon here on tha irth, tha fowk o aa tha nations wull be hairt scarred an at thair wut’s enn wi tha souch o tha roarin sea an tha waves.
Fowk’ll be that feart, the’ll be takkin dwams acause o whut the’ see cumin on tha warl. Fer tha verie pooers o tha lïft wull be shuk oot o kïlter.
An then aa fowk wull see tha Sinn o Man cumin ïn a clood wi aa hïs pooer an muckle glorie.
Whaniver aa these thïngs stairts tae cum aboot, stan up strecht, lïft up yer heids, fer yis’ll shuin be delïvert oot o hairm’s wye."
An he toul thaim thïs parable:

Tak a luk at tha fïg tree, or onie ither tree. 
LUK.21.30	Whan tha leafs cum oot, yis ken wi’oot bein toul, tha simmer’s no faur aff. 
LUK.21.31	Sae, whan yis see these thïngs happenin, yis can be shair tha Kïngdom o God ïs nearhan.
LUK.21.32	A tell yis tha truith, thair’s fowks leevin noo that’ll no dee, afore aa these thïngs haes cum aboot. 
LUK.21.33	Heiven an irth wull pass awa, but ma wurds wull niver pass awa.
LUK.21.34	Tak care ye ir no bluthert, or yer heids turnt wi wile leevin. An dïnnae fash yersels aboot tha worries o thïs life. Dïnnae alloo that day tae faa on yis o a suddent, laik a thrap. 
LUK.21.35	Fer thon day wull cum on iveriebodie leevin ïn tha hale warl. 
LUK.21.36	Sae ay keep an ee oot then, an pray yis micht be strang eneuch tae stan afore tha Sinn o Man, an be spared aa these thïngs that ir gaun tae happen.
Iverie day, Jesus went tae tha Hoose o God tae taich tha fowk, but he spent iverie nicht on tha Moont o Olives.
An aa tha fowk cum at tha furst licht tae lïsten tae hïm ïn tha Hoose o God.
Noo tha Faist o Bairmless Breid, caad tha Passower, wus nearhan.
An tha heid preeshts an maistèrs o tha Laa wus colloguin thegither hoo tae get rïd o Jesus on tha quait, fer the’ wur feart o whut tha fowk micht dae.
Then Satan cum ïntae tha hairt o Judas, tha yin caad Iscariot, that wus yin o tha Twal;
an Judas went tae tha heid preeshts an offyshers o tha Temple gaird an taakt aboot hoo he micht han Jesus ower tae thaim.
The’ wur weel plaised, an struck a dail wi hïm, tae gie hïm siller fer hïs wark.
Sae Judas made a paction, an he lukt fer a guid apenin tae han Jesus ower tae thaim, whaniver thair wus nae crood aboot.
Noo tha Day o Bairmless Breid cum alang, whan tha lambs wus kïllt fer tha Passower.
An Jesus bïd Petèr an Jhone tae gang on aheid, fer tae mak readie tha Passower mail fer thaim tae ait thegither.
The’ axt hïm, "Whar wud ye hae iz mak ït readie?"
An he saed tae thaim, "Tha mïnit yis cum ïntae tha cïtie, a man cairryin a crockerie jar o wattèr wull meet yis. Follae hïm tae tha hoose he gangs ïntae,
an say tae tha guidman o tha hoose: 'Tha Maistèr says: Whar ïs tha ruim whar A can ait tha Passower wi ma follaers?'
An he wull show yis a bïg upstair ruim, plenisht an aa. Yis ir tae mak ït readie thair."
The’ went an fun ït jist as he haed saed. An the’ made readie tha boord fer tha Passower mail.
An whaniver tha time cum tae stairt, Jesus tuk hïs place at tha boord, an tha twal possels alang wi hïm.
An he saed tae thaim, "A hae bin langin wi aa ma hairt tae ait thïs Passower mail wi yis, afore A suffer.
Fer A’m tellin yis aa noo, A’ll no ait ït agane tae tha Kïngdom o God ïs cum."
Then he tuk tha bicker ïn hïs hans, gien thenks tae God, an saed, "Tak thïs, an shair ït oot amang yis.
Fer A tell yis thïs: frae noo on, A’ll no drïnk o tha fruit o tha vine afore tha Kïngdom o God haes cum."
An he tuk tha breid as weel, an whaniver he haed gien thenks tae God, he brauk ït, an hannit ït tae thaim, an saed, "Thïs ïs ma bodie [gien fer you. Dae thïs ïn mine o me."
In tha same wye, eftèr supper he tuk tha bicker o wine an saed, "Thïs bicker ïs a sign o God’s new coveynant sealed wi ma bluid poored oot fer you.]
But tak heed, tha yin that’s gaun tae gie me up ïs at tha boord alang wi me.
Fer masel, tha Sinn o Man, A maun dee accordin tae God’s plan. But wile sorra tae tha yin that bethrays me!"
Then the’ begun tae taak amang thairsels, axin whutch yin o thaim wud dae sitch an a thïng.
An thair wus a thraw on amang thaim, as tae whut yin o thaim shud be tha maist heich.
Jesus toul thaim: "In thïs warl, kïngs laird ït ower thair ain fowk, an thair heidyins gets tha name o daein guid.
But wi yous, ït's no tae be laik that. Amang yous, tha maist heich shud be laik tha maist hummel, an a heidyin shud be laik a sarvint.

Fer whut yin’s mair impoartin amang yis, hïm that’s sïttin at tha boord, or tha yin that sarves hïm? Is ït no tha yin that’s at tha boord? Aye, ye wud thïnk that wud be richt. But no here! Fer A am amang yis as yin that sarves.
Yous ir tha yins that hae stud bye me ïn reuch times.
An jist as ma Faither haes gien a Kïngdom tae me, sae A masel wull gie you tha richt tae ait an drïnk at tha boord ïn ma Kïngdom. An yis’ll sït doon on thrones an judge tha twal clans o Israel.
An wi that, he went on tae say, "Simon, Simon, lïsten tae me! Satan haes axt tae hae yis aa, fer tae rïddle ye as wheat.
But A hae prayed fer ye, Simon, that yer faith wull houl oot. An whan ye hae turnt bak tae me, ye ir tae haud up yer brithers."
An Petèr saed, "Loard, A’m readie tae gang tae jail wi ye, or e’en tae dee wi ye."
A’m tellin ye, Petèr, saed Jesus, "tha roostèr wull no craa themorra moarnin, afore ye hae saed thrie times ower that ye dïnnae ken me."
An he went on tae say tae thaim aa: "Whan A sent yis oot wi nae pooch, nae baag, an nae shune, dïd yis want fer ocht?" An the’ saed, "Naethin ava!"
But noo, saed Jesus, "If yis hae a pooch or a baag, tak thaim wi yis. An ïf ye hinnae a sword, sell tha cóat aff yer bak, an buy yin.
It’s writ doon ïn tha Scrïptures: 'He wus coontit amang tha laa brekkers.' An A tell yis that whut wus writ doon thair aboot me maun cum aboot. Deed aye, ït wull aa cum aboot."
An the’ saed, "Loard, here’s twa swords." Saed he bak tae thaim, "That’ll dae!"
An Jesus cum oot o tha hoose an made hïs róad tae tha Moont o Olives, as he wus ïn tha habit o daein. An hïs follaers went alang wi hïm.
Whan he got tae tha place, he toul thaim: "Pray that whan ye ir tempit, ye dïnnae gie ïn tae ït."
He went awa as faur as ye cud clod a stane, an he got doon on hïs knees an prayed,
sayin, "Faither, ïf ye ir wullin, wud ye tak thïs cup o sufferin awa frae me? Aa tha same, no ma wull, but yours be daen."
[Then an angel frae heiven appeart til hïm, an gien hïm strenth.
An bein ïn a wile agonie, Jesus prayed mair an mair frae tha hairt, tae tha sweit wus faain aff hïm tae tha grun, laik bïg draps o bluid.]
Whan he wus daen prayin, he got ontae hïs feet an went bak tae hïs follaers. He fun thaim sleepin, aa wore oot wi sorra.
An he saed tae thaim: "Whut ir yis sleepin fer? Git up an pray, less ye gie ïn tae temptation!"
Tha wurds wus harlie oot o hïs mooth, whan up cum a hale thrang o fowk. An Judas, yin o tha Twal, wus at tha heid o thaim. He waakit up tae Jesus, an he gien hïm a kïss o greetin.
But Jesus saed tae hïm: "Judas, wud ye bethray tha Sinn o Man wi a kïss?"
Whan Jesus’ ither follaers saa whut wus aboot tae happen, the’ saed, "Loard, shud we tak oor swords tae thaim?"
An yin o thaim hut tha sarvint o tha Heich Preesht, an he sneddit hïs richt lug aff.
But Jesus saed, "Houl on! Nae mair o that!" An he püt hïs han on tha ear an healt tha man.

Then Jesus saed tae tha heid preeshts, tha offyshers o tha Temple gaird an tha eldèrs, that haed cum oot tae tak houl o hïm: "Am A some soart o a reiver, that yis hae cum oot wi swords an stavs agin me?
Whan A wus wi yis iverie day ïn tha Hoose o God, yis niver layed a fing'r on me. But thïs ïs tha time fer yous tae ect; tha pooer o dairkness ïs ower yis noo."
Then the’ tuk houl o Jesus, an led hïm oot, an brocht hïm tae tha Heich Preesht’s hoose. Petèr wus follaein behin, keepin hïs distance.
An the’ kinnelt a fire ïn tha mïddle o tha coortyaird, an the’ sut doon thegither, an Petèr amang thaim.
An thair wus thïs wee sarvin lass tuk a clase luk at hïm ïn tha lowe o tha fire. "Thïs man wus wi hïm tae," saed she.
But Petèr saed, "Na, na, lass, A dïnnae know hïm."
Eftèr a while anither yin saa hïm an saed, "Ye ir yin o thaim tae." But Petèr saed, "Man, na, A’m naethin o tha soart!"
An aboot an oor eftèr that, anither yin insïstit: "Thïs fella wus shairlie wi hïm, fer wi’oot a doot he’s frae Galilee tae!"
But wi that Petèr saed: "Man, A dïnnae know whut ye ir taakin aboot!" An tha wurds wusnae richt aff hïs tung, whan a roostèr craad.
An tha Loard turnt an lukt at Petèr. An Petèr haed mine o hoo tha Loard haed saed tae hïm: "Afore tha roostèr craas ïn tha moarnin, ye wull deny me thrie times."
An Petèr went oot o tha coortyaird, greetin sair.
Noo tha men houlin Jesus wur mockin hïm, an giein hïm a guid whalin.
An the’ püt a blinfoul on hïm, [the’ hut hïm on tha face], an axt: "Weel, proaphit, tell iz wha skelpt ye?"
An the’ caad hïm iverie name unnèr tha sin.
Then at tha scraich o day, aa tha eldèrs o tha fowk gethert thegither, baith tha heid preeshts an tha maistèrs o tha Laa. The’ led Jesus awa tae thair Cooncil, an the’ saed tae hïm:
If ye ir tha Christ, tell iz! An he saed bak tae thaim: "If A dae tell yis, yis’ll no believe me.
An ïf A ax yis oniethin, yis’ll no gie me an answer oniehoo.
But frae thïs time forrit, tha Sinn o Man wull be saitit at tha richt han o tha Michtie Yin."
An the’ aa saed, "Sae ye ir tha Sinn o God, then?" An Jesus saed bak tae thaim, "Weel, ye saed ït yersels!"
Whut mair proof dae we need? the’ axt. "Noo we hae heerd ït fer oorsels frae hïs ain mooth!"
Then tha Cooncil, tha hale lock o thaim, tuk Jesus an brocht hïm up tae Pilate.
An the’ stairtit tae brïng chairges agin hïm, an saed, "We fun thïs man leadin tha fowk asthray, tellin thaim no tae pye onie tex tae Caesar, makkin hissel oot tae be Christ tha Messiah, an a kïng!"
Pilate axt Jesus: "Ir you tha Kïng o tha Jews?" An Jesus saed bak tae hïm: "You hae saed ït."
Then Pilate saed tae tha heid preeshts an tha thrang o fowk: "A cannae fin oniethin agin thïs man!"
But the’ kep on at Pilate, sayin, "Thïs man ïs stïrrin up naethin but bother, wi tha thïngs he’s bin lairnin tha fowk tha lenth an breadth o tha lan, frae Galilee richt doon tae here."
Whan Pilate heerd thïs, he axt: "Ach, daes he cum frae Galilee then?"
An as shuin as he fun oot that Jesus cum unnèr Herod’s thortie, he sent hïm up tae hïm, fer Herod happent tae be ïn Jerusalem hissel at tha time.
Noo whan Herod saa Jesus, he wus hairt gled, fer he haed heerd aa aboot hïm an haed bin langin tae see hïm. He haed hopt he micht see hïm daein some miracle.
Sae he axt Jesus a hale lock o questions, but Jesus niver saed a wurd bak.
An tha heid preeshts an tha maistèrs o tha Laa wus stannin aboot, hoochin an yellin thair accusations agin Jesus.
Herod alang wi hïs sodgers jeert an made lïttle o hïm, rïggin hïm oot ïn a braw fancie goon. An the’ sent hïm agane tae Pilate.
That verie day Herod an Pilate becum guid freens: afore that thair wus nae love loast atween thaim.
Sae Pilate caad thegither tha heid preeshts an ither releejus heidyins, alang wi aa tha ordinarie fowk.

An he saed tae thaim, "Yis hae brocht thïs man afore me sayin that he wus stïrrin up fowk an casin bother. A hae examined hïm afore yis aa, an A hae fun naethin wrang ava, as faur as whut yis say he haes daen.
Na, Herod dïdnae ither, fer he sent hïm bak tae iz. Lïsten tae me, thïs man haes daen naethin tae warrant bein püt tae deith.
Sae A’ll gie hïm a whalin tae lairn hïm a lesson, an let hïm gang!"
[Fer he maun let yin wrangdaer gang at tha Faist.]
Then tha hale crood o thaim yellt oot, "Awa wi thïs man! Let Barabbas oot!"
Noo Barabbas haed bin püt ïn jail fer murdèr an riotin ïn Jerusalem.
Pilate wantit tae let Jesus gang free, sae he spauk agane tae thaim aa.
But the’ kep on cryin oot, "Crucyfie hïm! Crucyfie hïm!"
Pilate saed tae thaim a thurd time, "Why, whut wrang haes he daen? A dïnnae fin oniethin tae pit hïm tae deith ower. A’ll gie hïm a whalin an let hïm gang."
But tha hale thrang shoutit aa tha mair that Jesus shud be crucyfied. An tha crood an tha heid preeshts got thair ain wye.
Sae Pilate gien ïn tae whut the’ wantit;
he daen as the’ axt hïm, an he let gang tha man that haed bin püt ïn jail fer riot an murdèr.
But Jesus he hannit ower tae thaim; the’ cud dae whut the’ wantit wi hïm.
As the’ led Jesus awa, the’ clappt hans on Simon o Cyrene, that wus on hïs wye ïn frae tha kintrie. The’ püt tha cross on hïs shoodèr, an the' gart hïm tae cairrie ït behin Jesus.
A hale crood o fowk wus follaein ahint hïm, an amang thaim a lock o weemen that wur batin thair breeshts an lamentin ower whut wus gaun tae happen tae Jesus.
But Jesus turnt roon tae thaim an saed, "Dochtèrs o Jerusalem, dïnnae greet fer me, greet fer yersels an yer weans!
Fer luk, tha day’s no faur aff, whan the’ wull be sayin, 'Blisst ir tha weemen that’s barren, an tha wames that niver bair weans, an tha breeshts that niver gie mïlk.'
In that day the’ wull stairt sayin tae tha muntins: 'Faa doon on iz!' An tae tha hïlls, 'Cover iz ower!'
Noo ïf the’ wud dae that whaniver tha tree ïs ïn fu leaf an growin weel, whut wull the’ dae whaniver tha trees ir wuthert?"
Twa ithers as weel, that wur crïmnals, wur led oot tae be püt tae deith alang wi Jesus.
An whan the’ cum tae tha place caad "Calvarie"
[An Jesus saed, "Faither, forgie thaim, fer the’ dïnnae ken whut the’r daein."] An tha sodgers gemmelt fer hïs claes, pairtin thaim amang thairsels.
Aa tha while, tha fowk stud bye, lukkin on. But tha heidyins o tha Jews giekt at hïm, sayin, "He saved ithers. Let hïm save hissel, ïf he’s God’s Messiah, tha chosen yin!"
Tha sodgers jeert hïm tae, cumin up an offerin hïm soor wine.
An the’ saed tae hïm, "If you ir tha Kïng o tha Jews, save yersel!"
An the’ püt up a signboord abain hïm [an ït saed ïn tha Greek, tha Latin an tha Hebrew]: "THIS IS THA KING O THA JEWS"
Noo yin o tha crïmnals hingin alangside o hïm yellt abuse at hïm: "Ir ye no tha Messiah?" he axt. "Save yersel, an iz forbye!"
But tha ither yin gien aff tae hïm, an axt hïm: "Dae ye no fear God, seein as ye ir condemned tae dee as weel?
We ir jist gettin whut we desarve fer whut we hae daen. But thïs man haes daen naethin wrang ava!"
An wi that he saed, "[Loard] Jesus, keep mine o me whan ye cum ïntae yer Kïngdom."
Saed Jesus bak tae hïm: "A tell ye tha truith, ye’ll be wi me ïn paradise thïs verie day!"
Bi thïs time ït wus nuin, an dairkness cum ower tha hale lan tae thrie ïn tha eftèrnuin.
Tha licht o tha sin wus blekt oot, an tha curtin hingin ïn tha Halie o Halies wus torn ïn twa.
Then Jesus cryed oot wi a lood voice: "Faither, A gie ma spïrit up ïntae your hans!" An wi that, he gien hïs last breath.
Noo whan tha centurion
An aa tha fowk that cum tae see whut wus gaun on, whan the’ saa whut wus daen, the’ bate thair breeshts ïn sorra an went awa.
An aa Jesus’ freens alang wi tha weemen that follaed hïm frae Galilee, stud awa bak takkin ït aa ïn.

Noo thair wus a man caad Joseph, a cooncillor, a guid an dacent man, that haednae gan alang wi thair deceesion tae kïll Jesus. He wus frae Arimathea, a toon o tha Jews, an he wus bidin hïs time, waitin on tha Kïngdom o God tae cum.
Joseph went tae Pilate an axt fer tha bodie o Jesus.
An he tuk ït doon frae tha cross, lapt ït ïn lïnen claith, an laid ït ïn a tomb cut oot o tha roak, whar naebodie haed bin layed afore.
An ït wus late ïn tha day on Friday, tha day fer gettin readie fer tha Sabbath.
Tha weemen that haed cum wi Jesus frae Galilee follaed eftèr, an the’ tuk heed o tha tomb an hoo hïs bodie wus layed oot thair.
The’ went awa an made up spices an ointments, an then the’ stapt thair wark fer tha Sabbath day accordin tae tha commaun o God.
On tha furst day o tha week, at tha scraich o day, tha weemen cum tae tha tomb, an brocht tha spices the’ haed makkit readie. [An thair wus ither yins alang wi thaim.]
An the’ fun tha stane rowlt awa frae tha tomb.
The’ went ïn, but tha bodie o tha Loard Jesus wus naewhar tae be saen.
An the’ wur wile fasht aboot ït. Aa o a suddent, thair wur twa men stannin bye ïn bricht claes.
Tha weemen wus hairt feart, an bood doon wi thair faces tae tha grun. An tha men saed, "Fer why ir yis lukkin tha leevin amang tha deid?
[He’s no here, he’s ris!] Dae yis no mine hoo he taakt tae yis bak ïn Galilee,
sayin, 'Tha Sinn o Man maun be gien ïntae tha hans o sïnfu men tae be crucyfied, an tha thurd day rise agane'?"
Aye, richt eneuch, the’ saed, "that’s jist whut Jesus toul iz wud happen."
Sae the’ cum awa frae tha tomb, an toul tha leven possels aa that haed cum aboot, an the’ toul aa tha rest o thaim as weel.
It wus Mary Magdalene, an Johanna, an Mary tha mither o Jeames, an ither weemen that wur wi thaim that toul these thïngs tae tha possels.
An the’ dïdnae believe thaim, an thocht the’ wur taakin blethers.
Then Petèr got up an run tae tha tomb an stoopit doon an keekt ïn. He saa tha linen claiths lyin bye thair lane, an he went awa wunnèrin tae hissel whut haed cum aboot.
That same day, twa o Jesus’ follaers set oot fer tha vïllage o Emmaus, sïx or seiven mile frae Jerusalem.
An the’ wur taakin tae yin anither aboot aa tha goins-on.
An whan the’ wur taakin aboot ït an tryin tae unnèrstan ït, Jesus hissel cum up alangside o thaim an waakit wi thaim.
The’ saa hïm aa richt, but the’ dïdnae ken wha he wus.
An he saed tae thaim, "Whut wur ye taakin aboot thair, alang tha róad?" The’ cum tae a stap, lukkin doon ïn tha mooth.
An yin o thaim, caad Cleopas, saed tae hïm, "Ye maun be a stranger ïn Jerusalem ïf ye hinnae heerd ocht o whut’s bin happenin thair ïn tha last wheen o days!"
Saed he tae thaim, "Whut thïngs?" An the’ saed, "Dïd ye no hear aboot Jesus o Nazareth, a proaphit, michtie ïn hïs wurds an daeins afore God an aa tha fowk?
An aboot hoo oor heid preeshts an heidyins hannit hïm ower? The’ passt a sentence o deith on hïm, an nailt hïm tae a cross, sae the’ dïd.
We haed thocht he wus tha yin that wud redeem Israel. Oniehoo, ït’s thrie days since thïs happent.

Aye, an parteeclar weemen frae amang iz, that wur up earlie at hïs tomb, tuk iz bak whan the’ saed the’ cudnae fin hïs bodie, an the’ cum bak an toul iz the’d saen a vïsion o angels sayin Jesus wus leevin!
An sartin o thaim that wus amang iz went tae tha tomb an richt eneuch, the’ fun ït jist as tha weemen haed saed: Jesus wusnae thair."
Then Jesus saed tae tha twa o thaim, "Ye coafs, yis ir slow tae tak ïn aa that tha proaphits spauk aboot!
The’ saed that Christ wud hae tae dree aa these thïngs afore he gaed ïntae hïs glorie, dïd the’ no?"
An stairtin wi Moses an aa tha proaphits, he made plain tae thaim whut aa tha Scrïptures saed aboot hissel.
An whan the’ cum nearhan tha vïllage whar the’ wur gaun, he lukt as ïf he wus gaun on furdèr.
But the’ coaxt hïm, sayin: "Wud ye no stap wi iz, fer ït’s dailygan, an ït’ll be dairk shuin?" Sae he went ïn wi thaim.
An ït cum aboot, as he sut doon tae ait wi thaim, that he tuk breid, blisst ït an brauk ït, an gien ït tae thaim.
An aa o a suddent thair een wus apent, an the’ kent wha he wus, an wi that Jesus wus nae mair tae bi saen!
The’ saed tae yin anither: "Dïd ït no set oor hairts a-low, whan he taakt tae iz on tha róad, an apent up tha Scrïptures tae iz?"
Sae the’ ris up tha same oor, an the’ went bak tae Jerusalem, an fun tha leven gethert thegither, an thaim that wur wi thaim.
Tha Loard ïs ris, richt eneuch! the’ wur toul. "An Simon haes saen hïm!"
An tha twa frae Emmaus toul aa that haed happent on tha róad, an hoo the’ knowed ït wus Jesus tha mïnit he brauk tha breid.
An jist as the’ wur taakin, thair stud Jesus ïn tha mïddle o thaim aa, [an he saed tae thaim: "Peace be wi yis!"]
But the’ wur aa hairt scarred an afeart, an thocht the’ haed saen a wraith.
An he saed tae thaim, "Fer why ir yis püt aboot? An why aa tha doots wi’ïn yersels?
Tak a luk at ma hans an ma feet. It’s masel! Hannle me an see! Fer a wraith haesnae flesh an banes as yis see A hae."
[An eftèr sayin thïs, he showed thaim hïs hans an hïs feet.]
An the’ wur that blythesum an dumfoonèrt, the’ cud harlie tak ït ïn. An he axt thaim, "Hae yis ocht tae ait ïn tha hoose?"
The’ gien hïm a bït o brannèrt fïsh, [an a wee bït o honeycomb],
an he tuk ït an et ït afore thaim.
Then he saed tae thaim: "Thïs ïs whut A toul ye whaniver A wus still amang yis, that aa tha thïngs that wur writ doon consarnin me ïn tha Laa o Moses, tha Proaphits an tha Psalms maun cum aboot."
Then he apent thair mines tae unnèrstan tha Scrïptures,
sayin tae thaim: "It’s writ doon that tha Christ maun suffer, he maun dee an rise frae tha deid tha thurd day;
an that wi ma thortie yis ir tae praich thïs message tae aa nations: 'Repent o yer sïns, an God wull forgie yis.' Yis ir tae stairt frae Jerusalem.
Yous hae saen these thïngs, sae yis ir wutnesses o thaim aa.
Noo, lïsten tae me, A wull senn upon yis tha gïft ma Faither promist. But yous ir tae stap here, ïn Jerusalem, tae yis ir claithed wi pooer frae abain."
An Jesus led thaim oot tha lenth o Bethanie, an thair he lïftit up hïs hans an blisst thaim.
An ït cum aboot, that while he wus blissin thaim, he pairtit frae thaim, an he wus taen up ïntae heiven.
[An the’ wurshipt hïm] an the’ went bak tae Jerusalem wi blythesum hairts.
An the’ spent aa thair time laudin an blissin ïn tha Hoose o God.
